characters: YEARS LATER OF A BROKEN HEART."
AND ADVISER TO HIS COUSIN ELIZABETH.."
COURT FOR THE REST OF THEIR LIVES."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1 We're moving through a cornfield. At speed. The sound of children's laughter. Excited shrieking. A beautiful young girl, (MARY BOLEYN, 8), our heroine, ru through the fields, being chased by her younger brother, and sister, ANNE, (10). Touchingly, MARY is barely taller than the corn, her head skimming along the sheaves. REVERSE ANGLE TO REVEAL: the children are being watched b parents, (SIR THOMAS and LADY ELIZABETH BOLEYN).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I received a formal request for marriage today for Anne. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the Carey family. SIR THOMAS indicates to ANNE; the eldest. Dark-haired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intelligent. The obvious leader among the children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I turned it down. LADY ELIZABETH turns...`What?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And offered them Mary instead. SIR THOMAS indicates  MARY, the middle child. Fair-haired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty. Sweet-natured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fnne's too good for William Carey. She can do (better than a merchant's son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You underestimate Mary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not true. I think she's..the kinder of the two. Quite possibly the fairer. The CHILDREN, meanwhile, have started a race..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But to get ahead in this world, you need more than fair looks and a kind heart. On the field, ANNE wins. She jumps up and down, holding h aloft, as MARY flops to the floor. Vanquished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIR THOMAS smiles, `See?' He walks towards ANNE..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (applauding his favourite)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravo! Anne!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2 Bells ring high up in the bell-tower of a country church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3 MARY, ten years older, and grown into a heavenly bride is room, surrounded by MAIDS and SEAMSTRESSES making final adjustments to her dress. A knock at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May we come in..? ANNE and GEORGE enter. GEORGE lets out a low whistle..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at you..! Younger than me. More beautiful than me. Married before me. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am eclipsed. I am just the `Other Boleyn Girl.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, is this it? This is the end of the unholy trinity? GEORGE extends her arms, wraps them around his two sister intimate moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, George. Never. I'll be married, that's all.. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apart from that - it won't change a thing. The three of them hug together, tightly..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4 A packed country church. The PRIEST officiates in Latin. is thick with incense. And winter cold..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire BOLEYN FAMILY is assembled on one side. FATHER MOTHER, the DUKE and DUCHESS of NORFOLK, brother GEORGE, finally ANNE..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confirma hoc, Deus, quod operatus es in nobis.. The PRIEST sprinkles the ring with holy water. WILLIAM CA (35), puts it on MARY's finger. few rows back, a young NOBLEMAN stares at ANNE. Looks at across the church. Obviously attracted. ANNE notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 5 The party afterwards. MUSICIANS play. The bride and groom (WILLIAM and MARY), are dancing, surrounded by WELL-WISHE other GUESTS..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you happy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't secretly wish you'd married someone grander? With a title?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I want a husband who loves me. And who thinks it first thing every morning. And last thing at night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you've found the right man.

dialogues.speaker: IN ANOTHER CORNER
dialogues.text: ANNE is dancing with her brother GEORGE. She looks up to NOBLEMAN who was staring at her across the church..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is that? He was staring at me in church?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Henry Percy. Heir to the Duke of Northumberland. Richest landowner in England. ANNE's eyes widen in interest, "Really?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But don't get your hopes up. He is already betrothed. GEORGE indicates a tall, haughty-looking FIANCEE beside P

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betrothed is not married, brother George. A lot can happen before you reach the altar. ANNE stares over at HENRY PERCY. Who stares back.

dialogues.speaker: IN ANOTHER CORNER
dialogues.text: 6 he DUKE OF NORFOLK, the most powerful nobleman in the roo close personal friend of the KING's walks with his growli to where SIR THOMAS BOLEYN and LADY ELIZABETH are sitting THOMAS gets to his feet..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas.. he DUKE ignores THOMAS, and goes instead to his sister, ( ELIZABETH), and kisses her..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I have managed to persuade the King to come and stay with you on progress. A week-end's hunting in late summer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's wonderful! Thank you, thank you so much.. (he turns to ELIZABETH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear that, Elizabeth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hates the idea)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally we can present George, and with luck, get him a position at court. LADY ELIZABETH excuses herself, and leaves..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are difficult times. I have it on good authority that the Queen no longer bleeds - yet the matter of a male heir is still not resolved. a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It cannot be long before the King is forced to look outside the marriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? And make a bastard King of England?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A legitimized bastard. What choice does he have? (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously, I've given it thought, and wondered which Howard girl I could put under his nose. Imagine the influence that would give us. To be blood family of the next King of England. Equally, imagine if another family were to achieve the same? NORFOLK indicates SIR JOHN SEYMOUR in the corner, and his loathsome, ambitious sons EDWARD and THOMAS..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Anne? SIR THOMAS turns, and indicates ANNE across the crowds, w dancing with GEORGE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I realise as a `Boleyn' she is not officially a `Howard', but as your sister's daughter..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she's your eldest, Thomas. Your first born. And your favourite. Wouldn't you prefer her to have a nice, uncomplicated, respectable marriage? Like Mary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Anne were an uncomplicated, respectable girl like Mary, then I'd say `yes'. But she's not. SIR THOMAS looks out at ANNE..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's anything but.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 7 SIR THOMAS and LADY ELIZABETH stand in a corner, watching party continue. ELIZABETH's face darkens..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: don't like it. It would cost a fortune to make our house fit for a royal visit. Money we don't have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what if theDY ELIZABETH(cont'd) LA king doesn't like her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or if she sleeps with him but gives him a girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what if you were to look on the bright side? Just once? An ominous clap of thunder outside..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Risk nothing, you gain nothing. ADY ELIZABETH stares at her husband..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hen was it that people stopped thinking of ambition as a sin, and started thinking of it as a virtue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy for you to say. You've had power and wealth all your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until I married you, Thomas. And I was happy to give it up. LADY ELIZABETH turns, and walks back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 8 ANNE knocks on the door of her father's study. She waits. Presently, the door opens. We see SIR THOMAS inside..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asked to see me father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Come in. SIR THOMAS closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 9 MARY is in a bathroom. Being prepared by ANNE for her wed night. ANNE brushes her sister's hair. Rubs oil in her sk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: o - the King himself is coming to Hever. I'm so happy for George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. But Father took me aside. It seems he has ambitions for me, too. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks I'm ANNE(coage dnow...and of not of an nt' )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: unpleasing appearance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What are you saying..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's known the King has a wandering eye. Imagine...if he were to like me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...you could never be more than his mistress. And that's no substitute for a husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But as the King's mistress the least I'd get after he finished with me would be an Earl. And if I fell pregnant? And gave him what his wife has failed to? a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite apart from the money, it'd be a Duke at least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what about your happiness? Your future? ANNE shrugs, smiles..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could be a happy Duchess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 0 MARY and ANNE enter the bedroom. A sea of candles. MARY s at the bed. A child. Suddenly terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you nervous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll tell me everything in the morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No details spared? The two SISTERS hug tightly. Visibly emotional. The door opens, and WILLIAM CAREY appears in the doorway. curtseys, gives MARY a last `Good luck' kiss, then goes. MARY stares at her husband. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold me a moment? WILLIAM CAREY envelops MARY with his arms.. MARY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so lucky to have a man who is content with what he has. MARY looks at him.. MARY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are, aren't you? WILLIAM CAREY smiles, looks at his gorgeous bride.. WILLIAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the luckiest man in the world. WILLIAM reaches for the wine.. WILLIAM (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink? MARY shakes her head. But WILLIAM tenderly insists.. WILLIAM (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should. It will hurt less. MARY nervously drinks.. WILLIAM (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lie back. MARY lies down. Then she lifts up her nightdress. WILLIAM down his trousers. MARY extends her hands. Inviting him to join her. WILLIAM lowers himself on top of her. He enters her. MARY smiles, in anticipation of pleasure. A side to her o might not have imagined. But one or two strokes later, and WILLIAM's knuckles whit face reddens, then he cries out, and slumps on top of her MARY looks up. Surely that wasn't it? WILLIAM (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILLIAM rolls over. MARY stares. Soon WILLIAM snores contentedly. MARY is wide awake. Confused. aybe this is how it's meant to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 11 The thunder of horses' hooves. A huge cloud of dust. The Royal Standard flutters in the wind. Beneath it, a SO in the KING's uniform, riding hard, dirt kicking up in hi The SOLDIER is flanked by a dozen other of the KING's SOL who lead a coloumn of fifty or more RIDERS.. It's like an army. A legion riding into battle. But it's This is just the KING OF ENGLAND going away for the week- Behind the advance party, is the KING himself, (30's), ha in his prime, surrounded by a dozen or so of his closest COURTIERS, (among them the DUKE of NORFOLK), a grand, tou intimidating lot. Behind them, comes the KING's CONFESSOR, a Priest with a ornate crucifix, a small library of religious books.. Then, in a riot of colour, come the MUSICIANS, the FOOL a PLAYERS, led by the MASTER of the REVELS. Behind them, come the SQUIRES and PAGES, carrying the Kin weapons, his jousting kit, his swords, his armour, his la etc. Then come the animals: FALCONS, in cages, and the HUNTING HOUNDS, beagles and pinchers, barking in excitement, and assortment of FRESH HORSES for travelling, and hunting. And finally, bringing up the rear, another unit of ARMED and a second STANDARD BEARER.. 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2 The BOLEYN family page, (WILLIAM STAFFORD), is perched on hill. Keeping watch. Staring into the distance.. Presently, he sees clouds of dust and the sound of thunde approaching. His expression changes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 13 Pandemonium breaks out among STAFF and FAMILY MEMBERS as STAFFORD calls out, "The King!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 14 ANNE is being dressed by MAIDS. Hearing the commotion out she rushes over to the window to see the approaching RIDE ANNE looks out of the window. Scans the approaching RIDER she finds the KING..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is! The young HENRY TUDOR is a dazzling, magnetic, intensely glamorous and handsome figure. A total contrast from the bloated, bearded figure of his later years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he will like me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, sister. How could he not? ANNE turns to face MARY. The two SISTERS embrace tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 15 The entire BOLEYN FAMILY is nervously assembled outside t house, (which we notice has been transformed at great cos marquees in the gardens. Fountains. Additional staff. Sma uniforms. New extensions to the stables and kitchens). MARY is discreetly hidden, among the CROWDS. ANNE is prid place. Visibly nervous. SIR THOMAS and LADY ELIZABETH are her. The proud PARENTS. Everyone bows deeply in deference as the King arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Majesty, you are most welcome. The King dismounts athletically. His DOGS are unleashed, excitedly..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir Thomas. kisses hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady Elizabeth.. A SERVANT in stiff, new uniform, with trembling hands, br wine on a tray. HENRY takes a glass..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I present my son, George. GEORGE, visibly nervous, bows deeply from the neck. But H attention has been caught by a beautiful woman behind GEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (while staring at MARY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Uncle tells me I should have you at court. Should I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be a great honour, Sir. MARY dutifully, modestly averts her eyes..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And our daughter, Anne. ENRY turns to see ANNE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one said anything of a daughter. ANNE curtseys deeply...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had we known, we might have come sooner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Majesty..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps you'll allow Anne to show you around our modest house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pleasure. ANNE offers HENRY her hand. He takes it, then leads ANNE MARY shoots ANNE a look, `Good luck'.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. HEVER
dialogues.text: 16 ANNE leads the KING through the house. She is followed at distance by SIR THOMAS BOLEYN. And watched by MARY and GE from a gallery above..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here is the library.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And through here, the observatory..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lovely.. HENRY looks up, his eye having been caught by something..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? HENRY points at an emblem above a doorway..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: falcon, your Grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see that. But what's it doing there? More to the point.. (turns 360)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..not just there, but in every corner in the house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea. Ask my father. a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps because falcons are vaguely associative with field sports - field sports with aristocracy - and in the absence of a genuine coat of arms.. (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a man with ambition will do the strangest things. HENRY is delighted by ANNE's candour..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a sharp tongue you have. a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder what it might say about me behind my back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, his Majesty has nothing to fear from me. Unless he fears an excess of compliments. HENRY smiles, visibly charmed..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? And what would they be..? WATCHING FROM ABOVE, MARY smiles to herself, "Well done, as HENRY and ANNE continue down a corridor..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 17 The entire BOLEYN FAMILY is assembled, frantically changi from her day attire to her finest evening clothes. SIR TH watches..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravo, Anne! The King was quite smitten! Told me so himself. And has requested you sit beside him at dinner. SIR THOMAS adjusts her hair..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My girl. My dear, remarkable girl. I knew you would up to the task. MARY watches. A momentary stab of jealousy at FATHER's attention. But as ANNE looks over at MARY for support.. MARY smiles. Shakes herself out of it. It's her sister. W she thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 18 MUSIC is being played. Everyone is dressed in their fines packed banquet hall. MUSICIANS come to a climax, loud and enthusiastic applause from everyone. HENRY gets to his fe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well played! And, may I say.. (a modest smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..an excellent choice of music too! nowing smiles from the COURTIERS, SIR THOMAS and LADY ELIZABETH, the DUKE of NORFOLK, etc..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir Thomas, Lady Elizabeth, dear Anne. Your health.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: ENRY raises his glass. Cheers and applause from the COURT A beaming SIR THOMAS raises his glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATER: dinner is served. Everyone is eating. HENRY and se close COURTIERS are engaged in debate..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..I had it from the lips of the Spanish ambassador himself. That our musicians are the envy of all Europe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..then he was flattering you, your Grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our Universities and philosophers, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...another lie. That honour would have to go to the Germans. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What of our painters, then? RANDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Years behind their Italian counterparts. The truth is far from leading the world, we're a provincial outpost, lagging far behind. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Is no one proud to be English? (turns to ANNE) Anne? What say you? ANNE gulps. The clanking of cutlery. All eyes on her. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, my Lord? clears throat) I know little of such matters, but I've not heard mention of our armies. Undefeated, I believe, in a generation. ENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well said. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or our navy? The finest in the world. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The universities in Spain and the philosophers in Germany may be strong, but are they really the equal of Oxford and Thomas More? HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never! ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt there is a country that is fairer in Government, or better protected by nature from her enemies, whose people are happier or more prosperous.. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's right, by God! She's right! HENRY is delighted. SIR THOMAS stares proudly across the ANNE. Who's hand, we notice, is shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her heart pounding in her chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 19 SIR THOMAS stops ANNE on her way upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did well tonight. Very well. Quite enough to be invited to court, I am sure of it. SIR THOMAS kisses ANNE's forehead..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now go to bed. Get a good night's sleep. Because there's still the hunt tomorrow. a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must excel at that. SIR THOMAS watches ANNE go. Admiring her. Then he turns t his wife, ELIZABETH. She turns away in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 20 MARY and ANNE lie together. In spoons position. ANNE is f asleep. MARY strokes her sister's hair. Eyes open. wo vulnerable, young children. 21

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The following morning.. Thirty or more RIDERS, STABLE-BOYS and HORSES are gathere one side, a deafening pack of DEER-HOUNDS, (wire-haired Lurchers), barking frantically. t's a scene of great activity, excitement, and anticipati The MASTER OF THE HORSE helps HENRY mount his steed - the biggest and most glamorous stallion of all, with wonderfu ornate saddlery. number of OTHER LADIES are also going hunting, and we not they ride pillion, (ie), riding on the same horse as thei sitting behind them, holding onto them..

dialogues.speaker: F
dialogues.text: inally, ANNE comes out. The KING turns..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Anne. ANNE curtseys deeply..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, your Grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ho will you be riding with? It's clearly an invitation. He indicates there is room fo on the back of his saddle. But ANNE fails to read the sig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On my own your Grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your own..? A STABLE-BOY leads out her horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have invented a new saddle which allows ladies to ride on their own. ANNE skilfully mounts the horse, and sits upright..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ut with no man to hold onto? How will you stay on the horse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? The same way you hold onto yours, your Grace. A flicker behind HENRY's eyes. It's the first wrong move has made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see. ENRY yanks the reins on his horse..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's away! ANNE shoots a look at MARY. Then follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 22 The thunder of hooves.. WILLIAM STAFFORD leads the way out with a pack of some fo fifty hounds. It's a stirring sight. Following the hounds thirty or forty RIDERS, led by the KING himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kicking his horse)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up ahead, the HOUNDS start to bark. Their pace increases. They've got a scent. The BUGLER blows his horn.. The DOGS begin to increase their pace. The RIDERS urge th horses to gallop. The LADIES hold tight to their MEN.. 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3 Up ahead, a STAG, wide-eyed, innocent, lifts it's head.. The sound of the hunting bugle and the roar of approachin footsteps, like thunder. The STAG twitches in fear, then bolts off towards the for

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 24 The DOGS and RIDERS roar across fields. The hounds snarl, delirious with primal agitation.. Among the RIDERS, the more advanced HORSEMEN have already up a clear lead on their weaker counterparts.. n the advanced group, are HENRY, several COURTIERS, his G and, of course, ANNE.. They jump over a hedge. One of HENRY's COURTIERS catches hedge and falls. HENRY smiles, then turns to see.. ANNE comfortably jumping the hedge herself. HENRY's smile He urges his horse to greater speed..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kicking his horse)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hah..!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 25 The terrified DEER bolts into safety of the forest. The b HOUNDS, locked into the scent, follow. he RIDERS see this, and some pull up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've lost him. He's in the forest. Galloping through trees and thick forest is not for the fainthearted. But HENRY charges past, kicking up dirt..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we must follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 26 HENRY weaves skilfully through low-hanging branches. He l over his shoulder, ANNE follows, close behind.. Sharp branches tear at HENRY's face. Some draw blood. Beh him, several other COURTIERS suffer lashes from the branc and pull up. But not ANNE. She kicks her horse harder. Se impervious to the whipping branches..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hah! Ahead, the DEER darts and weaves. The HOUNDS give chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 7 alf a mile ahead.. A steep ravine, with a sheer drop of twenty-five feet dee the bottom, a brook with dangerous rocks, then another sh climb of twenty-five feet the other side. The DEER arrives, looks, then scampers down the ravine, p by the HOUNDS. he remaining RIDERS arrive. They see the DEER scramble up other side, followed by the DOGS, slipping in the mud, an struggling with the brook. everal DOGS fall. Yelping in fright and pain as they lose footing and fall on the rocks. The KING pulls up his hors HENRY raises his hat, and salutes the DEER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he King of England defeated by a humble fawn. The COURTIERS laugh, then they turn their horses around a off. ANNE stares. It's a clear opportunity to impress. Sh down at the rocks. A long stare, then..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly kicking horse)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hah! The COURTIERS gasp in disbelief as ANNE lurches forward, leaps into space, heading fearlessly down the sheer ravin orse and rider almost tumble down the vertiginous, lethal But, reaching the bottom, the horse leaps across the broo scrambles up the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She made it! Exhilarated, ANNE turns, breathing hard. The stares at her. The COURTIERS stare at her. long silence. Nothing but the sound of wind in the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, your Majesty. It's not safe. HENRY turns and stares daggers at the COURTIER, `Silence' stares across the ravine at ANNE. Their eyes meet. hen he kicks his horse, `Hah!', and lurches forward. He h down the sheer ravine. The COURTIERS gasp, rush to the ed the ravine to watch. ANNE goes to the edge her side. ENRY's horse slides perilously down the ravine, then stru to clear the brook, and lands heavily in the water. he KING struggles to keep control, and as the horse tries scramble up the bank the other side, it loses it's footin

dialogues.speaker: T
dialogues.text: the mud, it's hooves grasping horrifically at air.. he COURTIERS cry out in horror, ANNE covers her mouth as. The KING's horse falls backwards, unseating HENRY, sendin flying, and worst of all, landing on top of him as they f tumble dreadfully down into the brook, and onto the rocks Pandemonium breaks out. The sound of shouting voices, cri horror, raising the alarm. ANNE's FACE: what has she done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 8 HENRY slowly comes to, to find himself staring at a numbe faces. A PHYSICIAN, SIR THOMAS BOLEYN, the DUKE of NORFOL or two COURTIERS, and finally, ANNE..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a miracle, Majesty, you have no broken bones.. HENRY flinches in agony, tries to move..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My daughter Anne is here. Would like to apologise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recoils, his pride hurt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Get her away from me! ANNE opens her mouth, wants to protest, but is hastily us out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATER: HENRY's wound is being dressed by MARY. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who are you? MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary, your Grace. Anne's younger sister. HENRY looks her up and down.. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been here all week-end? MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, your Grace. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? How could I have overlooked you? MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next to Anne, it's easy to do. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nonsense. HENRY sits up, takes H better look. Intrigued. a ENRY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about yourself. You're married? MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, your Grace. To William Carey. ENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Wolsey's office? MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, your Grace. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why haven't I seen you at court? MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I have persuaded him to spend a year or two here first. We have a small manor and some land. Nothing much. But enough to start a family. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A charmed life in the country? Away from it all? MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything I would have wished for myself. But then my brother died. a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And duty called. HENRY looks at MARY, then..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think he'll miss court? a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young, ambitious man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says not, your Majesty. MARY lowers her eyes..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, if he ever changed his mind, I would always support him. HENRY stares at MARY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 29 Strapped and bandaged, HENRY is helped onto his horse. Be him GEORGE BOLEYN is also on a horse, riding off to court the first time.. SIR THOMAS and LADY ELIZABETH bow, curtsey farewell..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you again, Lady Elizabeth. We'll take good care of your boy.. (kissing her hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Thomas.. HENRY embraces him, whispers in SIR THOMAS's ear..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll take care of that matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consider it done, your Majesty. HENRY shoots a lingering look at MARY, which ANNE notices the King and his entourage ride off. MARY waves farewell to GEORGE. ANNE stares. Suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 30 MARY and ANNE are sitting together. Presently the door op and WILLIAM STAFFORD emerges..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Father wishes to see you. MARY and ANNE get to their feet. STAFFORD raises his hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just Mary. MARY shoots ANNE a quizzical look, then goes with STAFFOR ANNE's smile fades. A flicker of suspicion. She follows..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 31 An intimidating atmosphere. Dogs lie at the feet of the D NORFOLK. SIR THOMAS looks up..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary, I don't know what you said or did - but you obviously made a deep impression on the King. exchanges a look with SIR THOMAS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he has requested you come to court with immediate effect. MARY's eyes widen in disbelief..'What?' 32

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNE listens at the door. Horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 33 WILLIAM STAFFORD watches from the doorway as the DUKE of NORFOLK, WILLIAM CAREY and SIR THOMAS smile delightedly, at MARY..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ou're to pack and leave first thing in the morning. MARY shoots a desperate look at her husband..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NORFOLK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The King himself has secured you a position in the Queen's household. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ut I don't want to go to court. Nor does my husband. Silence. SIR THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ell her. WILLIAM CAREY clears his throat. Avoids MARY's eyes.. WILLIAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The King has also offered me a position. As Gentleman of the Privy Council. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? SIR THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'hear that? Gentleman of the Privy Council! Attending to the private and personal needs of his Majesty himself! That's the inner sanctum! MARY's shell-shocked, lost for words.. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what about our future? Here in the country? NORFOLK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it out of your mind. From now on your home is at court. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William, please! Don't you understand what this means? MARY stares imploringly.. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will separate us. Put me in different accommodation. Where the King can always...find me. WILLIAM CAREY averts his eyes.. NORFOLK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happily your husband understands the value of such an opportunity. (a beat) For us all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Anne? Couldn't she go instead? SIR THOMAS's expression darkens. A flicker of pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way that girl behaved this week-end, she can count herself lucky she still has a home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 34 ANNE'S FACE, outside the door: it's as if a knife had bee plunged into her gut. She turns and runs down the corridor.. 35

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILLIAM and MARY lie in bed. MARY is equally wretched. Te

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: also running down her cheeks. She stares at her husband..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could he DO this to me? My own father. a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if we just refused?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We would be cut off. He made that clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But would that be so bad? MARY stares at him..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Position means nothing to me. Nor wealth. We could find somewhere. A small farm. Away from everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say that now - but when you're older? And our children are grown up? (comforting her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This won't last long. A year. Maybe two. And at the end of that - we'll we have everything we want. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's for our FUTURE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ut can't you see? Do this, and we might not HAVE a future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 36 MARY is getting ready to leave. She turns a corner and `b walks straight into ANNE. A tense moment. The two SISTERS at one another..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for? You think I want the King? Or to be used and abused by him? (puts on brave smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! You're welcome to him. I have my own plans, which don't involve becoming a rag that will one day be discarded. MARY stares, saddened, `Oh, Anne', but there's no time to She has to go. ANNE is left. Her eyes blazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 7 MARY and WILLIAM ride through London streets escorted by SERVANTS bringing their belongings. They approach Whiteha Palace. Armed GUARDS slowly open the gates. MARY's face: as the heavy gates open. She shoots a last l the `free' world outside. Then, she rides through the Pal gates. `CLANK', the heavy doors shut behind her. The outside world has been totally sealed off. Faces appe palace windows, staring down at the `new arrivals'. mong them: is HENRY himself. He stares out of the window. MARY. Then he lets the curtain fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 38 KATHERINE of ARAGON, (late-30's), imperious, intimidating Spanish. Surrounded by other LADIES IN WAITING, (mostly h born, Spanish, and the QUEEN's age). A SERVANT announces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Carey, Ma'am. QUEEN KATHERINE looks up..`Who?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new Lady in Waiting.

dialogues.speaker: I
dialogues.text: M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUEEN KATHERINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? But I was not expecting anyone. ERVANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Appointed by...his Majesty the King. QUEEN KATHERINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By my husband? Really? The air crackles with tension. It's school bullying. QUEEN KATHERINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then she must be some kind of gift. He must have seen in her some special talent that would please me. Tell me. What special talent is it that you have? with icy contempt) Apart from your obvious youth and beauty?

dialogues.speaker: T
dialogues.text: errified, MARY stammers.. MARY

dialogues.speaker: I...I..
dialogues.text: QUEEN KATHERINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: oetry, perhaps? MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: N-no.. QUEEN KATHERINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or dressmaking? MARY

dialogues.speaker: I..I..
dialogues.text: QUEEN KATHERINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music! That's it! You compose? Or sing? MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..I'm afraid not. Your Majesty. QUEEN KATHERINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come, you're too modest. turns to a MUSICIAN) Signor Vasquez. The Spanish GUITARIST obliges by starting to play a well- tune of the period.. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No..really..I beg you, your Majesty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barks, suddenly terrifying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I command you to SING!!! MARY flinches. Blushing deeply, her skin glowing with perspiration and terror, she begins to sing.. Normally she sings well. But her voice now is strangled w fear. MARY stands rigid, her knuckles whiten, nails diggi her hands, drawing blood. Finally, MARY finishes. The room is silent. All eyes on KATHERINE, who stares coldly. A formidable adversary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravo! A nightingale! (the cruel satisfaction of victory)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome at court!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 39 MARY walks through the packed corridors of court, her fac burning from the humiliation. The sound of a voice behind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ait! Mary! Stop! But MARY does not hear. She continues walking, distressed distractedly enters.. Finally, she is caught by JANE PARKER, whom we had seen a window earlier. Younger, also English, a kindred spirit..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that must have been agony, but put yourself in her shoes. She knows the only reason the King has asked you here is because he desires you. For a wife that must be very difficult. a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a good woman. Trust me. JANE smiles. MARY manages a smile..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane Parker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Carey. The two girls shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a brother, don't you? George?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen him a few times at court. And like him...very well. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't think he has noticed me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't imagine. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I mention you to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Happily. ANE PARKER smiles. But as soon as MARY's back is turned, smile fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 40 A large dusty yard, where KNIGHTS train for combat, and p their fighting skills. MARY is with GEORGE, who is puttin his armour..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not noticed her? Jane Parker? Of course I have. How could I not? She looks like a goat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she likes you, and asked me to give you this..to remember her by. MARY hands over a handkerchief..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh. Well say you haven't seen me. Or that you forgot. GEORGE hastily gives it back.. GEORGE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is something about that woman that makes me feel... (he shudders)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGE gets to his feet, indicates to his MALE COURTIER f that he is coming..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And our sister? Any word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNE? You know she took being upstaged by you very badly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And no amount of interventions on my behalf would make her believe you hadn't done it intentionally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you KNOW I would never do anything like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. GEORGE finds his helmet, puts it on.. GEORGE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give her time. She'll come round. MARY watches GEORGE go to join the other MALE COURTIERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 41 MARY enters her room, and closes the door. She begins undressing, taking off her clothes, then catches sight of in the shadows. She gasps. It's the KING's dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, don't be alarmed. ENRY steps out of the shadows.. MARY covers herself in modesty, and falls to her knees in curtsey of deference. HENRY steps into the light, walks t her..                H

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to find somewhere we could be alone so I might say a few words to you in person. ENRY turns, looks around the room..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope your accommodation is comfortable. I realise it's no substitute for the life you had in mind in the country.. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But please, give me the opportunity to try to make you happy here..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat) NRY(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moment I met you, I realised I.. HENRY tails off as MARY unbuttoning her dress..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tailing off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you..? MARY's dress comes off her shoulder. The KING's eyes, how instead of staring at MARY's beautiful, exposed body, sta focused on her eyes. An uncomfortable moment..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am sorry. (delicately putting her clothes back on MARY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You obviously misunderstand me. HENRY bows in respect, then turns, and takes his leave, l MARY standing in the room..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 42 The DUKE of NORFOLK stares in disbelief at MARY. His dogs intimidatingly at his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? If all the King wanted was coition, he could fetch in a woman from the bath house. a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What he wants is YOU. a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To woo you. And be wooed in return. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And could'nt you look just a little happier? There isn't a girl in the Kingdom that wouldn't wish to be in your shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your opinion, Uncle. MARY speaks quietly. Lowers her head..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine is that it's the greatest insult of all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asking a whore to have feelings, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 43 An incense-filled Royal Chapel. The ARCHBISHOP is giving in Latin, for the Royal Household. he King sits at the front, on the left. With the men. The ladies are separated, as is traditional, and sit on the r HENRY is lost in prayer. It's not long, however, before h to look at MARY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 44 Meanwhile, a remote country parish church. Far away. local PRIEST arrives. He sees two HORSES tethered to a tr the side of the church. He dismounts. Checks no one has f him. hen he enters the church. 4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 5 In the Royal chapel: the ARCHBISHOP solemnly performs the Eucharist, breaking bread and making wine from blood.. But, in full view of all those in the chapel, the KING co to stare at MARY. inally, she looks up. Their eyes meet. MARY blushes, aver gaze. But then, for the first time, she reciprocates. And back. This is witnessed by the QUEEN, and further back, by the NORFOLK and SIR THOMAS BOLEYN. Everyone is pretending to focus on the MASS. But none of can concentrate..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 46 In the country church: The PRIEST's eyes become accustome the dark. Everywhere, long shadows, eerie darkness..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you there? Presently, a WOMAN steps into the light. It's ANNE. Dress shawl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one saw you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You brought the money. ANNE hands over a purse of coins. They walk to the altar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the groom? Is he here? Up ahead, the GROOM slowly steps out of the shadows. Now his face. It's HENRY PERCY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Then let us begin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 47 Back at court: the service ends. Everyone in the Royal Household filters out of the church it's a very different atmosphere to when they entered.. The extent of HENRY's affection for MARY is now public kn evidenced by.. ..the attention SIR THOMAS and NORFOLK now receive from C WOLSEY and THOMAS CROMWELL, and the way in which QUEEN KA and her SPANISH LADIES are being neglected. MARY allows herself a private smile of satisfaction. Surp at how good it feels. To be the number 1.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 48 MARY lies in bed, in a room covered in flowers. She admir beautiful necklace in a box, and a handwritten letter fro KING. We can see from MARY's face how much she likes it. Presently, urgent `knock', `knock', at the door. MARY's e widen in excitement. The King? She hurriedly closes the necklace's box. Tucks the letter in a drawer. She gets out of bed. Anxiously straightens her hair, then to the door, to find.. GEORGE, her brother, who bursts in..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George? It's the middle of the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: t's Anne. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hat? GEORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he's married Henry Percy! MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (horrified) What? GEORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In secret. Without telling anyone! MARY's face falls.. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no...! GEORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: tailing off) You don't look pleased. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I be pleased? GEORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would make her the future Duchess of Northumberland. Our sister! MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they'll never allow it, don't you see? He's already precontracted to Mary Talbot, and if word of the consummation gets out her reputation will be ruined.. MARY pulls back her sheets.. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I have to tell Father. Before it's too late.. GEORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? GEORGE watches MARY go to the door.. GEORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary..! Wait! Come back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 49 A FAMILY MEETING: ANNE and HENRY PERCY, (the HANDSOME YOU NOBLEMAN from Mary's wedding), stand in front of the DUKE NORFOLK and SIR THOMAS BOLEYN and GEORGE..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you thinking? The marriage of a senior noble is a matter of state. Something only the King can decide.. HENRY PERCY looks down, avoiding eye contact..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knows about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then that is how it shall remain. Forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you cannot undo what has been done before God. (defiant stare)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And consummated too. `Snap', NORFOLK's quill breaks. SIR THOMAS almost chokes. GEORGE's eyes widen..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling to contain his anger)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There have been improper intimacies, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have lain with my husband. There is nothing improper about it..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SILENCE! My God, if you were my daughter I'd thrash you within an inch of your life.. ANNE recoils, terrified..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy will return to Northumberland - where he will marry the Talbot girl. As arranged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIR THOMAS gives the signal for WILLIAM STAFFORD to escor out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As for you. You will go to France and stay there until you have learned your lesson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you do this to your sister? You know full well her friendship with the King is at an extremely delicate stage. Any scandal or black mark against Mary's name now could be fatal. SIR THOMAS dismisses her..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will join the court of the French Queen. And stay there until your father has forgiven you. ANNE goes. GEORGE follows..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 50 MARY paces anxiously in the corridor. Presently, ANNE eme from the room. Burning with humiliation. Their eyes meet. is about to speak, but ANNE cuts her off..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ou told them, didn't you? a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How COULD you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you would never have got away with it. And it would have ruined your prospects forever. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me. I did it for your good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? For MY good? I'll try to remind myself of that. While I'm in exile. And you're here, in the King's bed, and unchallenged for our father's affection. a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That it was for MY good. Not yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNE, wait..!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNE storms out. GEORGE shoots MARY a look, "I'll deal wi this", and runs after ANNE.. OVER THIS: we fade in MUSIC and the sound of laughter..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1 A grand MASQUE BALL. We're in a spectacular candle-lit ba MUSICIANS play. Large formations of DANCERS perform elabo choreographed moves. Among them we pick out.. SIR THOMAS BOLEYN stalking the party. Ever watchful. On d Vigilant. He is distracted by the sight of... His son, GEORGE BOLEYN, surrounded by FRANCIS WESTON and FRIENDS. GEORGE is clearly in his element. Laughing in de Very fond and intimate with FRANCIS WESTON.. SIR THOMAS looks concerned for the first time. n another corner, MARY is in costume, but looking forlorn watches proceedings with a blank, distant expression. Pre a voice behind her..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why look so glum, Mary? MARY turns to see a MASKED MAN behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What reason have I to be happy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ou have two men, the King of England and I, both fighting for your love. The MASKED MAN is tall. His voice is quiet, but strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I know you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know me, Mary - but not half as well as I know you. I know you better than anyone here. And love you better than anyone here, too. And if God had made ME your husband instead of William Carey, one thing I know.. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would never have let you go. MARY's smile fades..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Who ARE you?

dialogues.speaker: B M
dialogues.text: M

dialogues.speaker: M
dialogues.text: M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY lunges for the MAN's MASK to try and remove it, but retreats into the safety of the shadows. Meanwhile.. All around MARY the crowds part, and a deep voice booms o ASKED MAN #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah! Who have we here?!? MARY turns to see a SECOND MASKED MAN, (unmistakably the surrounded by COURTIERS. M MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Kindness. MASKED MAN #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: wonder, will you be kind to me? MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it you desire? MASKED MAN #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: our love, fair Lady. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You demand a great deal. MASKED MAN #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more than I would give in return. MARY notices her FATHER is among the masked COURTIERS. Hi giving MARY cues.. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is easy for a man to declare love from behind a mask. ASKED MAN #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ut if I remove it, you might reject me. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If your feelings were sincere, I would never reject you. MASKED MAN #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you do not know who I am? I could be ugly. Or poor. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: o matter how you looked. Or who you were. MASKED MAN #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Then I shall hold you to your word. And unmask..! With a flourish, the KING rips off his mask..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Majesty..! SIR THOMAS urgently nods, `Go on!' MARY theatrically swoo Falling into the KING's arms. A gasp among the COURTIERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he faints! Quick! Take her to my rooms! Call my physicians..! SIR THOMAS quickly picks MARY up. He carries her through crowds, out of the ball-room.. QUEEN KATHERINE watches from a distance. A flicker of pai Then, with great dignity and pride, she turns back to wat entertainment..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 52 `Thump', the doors open, and MARY is carried into the Kin apartments. HENRY fusses, brings water. Opens windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! Leave us! Go! SIR THOMAS bows to the KING, shoots MARY meaningful look, fail me', and retreats. HENRY closes the doors. He and MA left alone. HENRY makes her comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, your Grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Henry', please. The first rule of this room, is to leave `Your Grace's' and `Your Majesty's' outside. ENRY looks up..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anything I can bring you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing to increase your comfort or well- being?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might ask your servants to bring me some water. HENRY goes to get water himself..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M H

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. There ARE no servants. MARY's eyes widen. The KING of ENGLAND brings her a drink takes a sip of her drink and watches as HENRY goes behind screen and begins to remove his costume. His mask. MARY notices a mirror, and watches in the reflection of t mirror how HENRY removes the costume and status of KING a becomes a MAN. Private. ENRY visibly unwinds, his facial muscles relax. He breath deeply. His face becomes softer. More gentle. Then he put comfortable robe, and emerges from behind the screen. HENRY goes over to a pile of cushions, and flops down - a smiles at MARY. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, this is it? This is where the King of England sleeps? HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And reads. And writes. And finds a few moments each day... (gestures) ...for himself. HENRY smiles at MARY.. HENRY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look surprised? MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. I suppose it's more.. MARY looks at the bed, the books, the pages of writing on desk.. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..simple than I imagined. ENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no need for show. I am only ever here alone. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And yet you invite me here? HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I trust you. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hardly know me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man in my position develops an instinct. a beat) You would never lie, could never lie to me. MARY smiles, admitting he's right. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I also sense...that you might relish an opportunity to be yourself, too. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, here you only say what you like, do what you like. M MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well. MARY smiles. Stretches out her legs. Relaxes.. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like an apple, please.. (can't believe she's saying this) ..Henry. HENRY jumps to his feet, brings MARY an apple. MARY laugh `Thank you'. Bites into the apple.. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it's your turn. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To say something, or do something you couldn't outside. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are many things I cannot admit to in public. Sadness, for example. And loneliness. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But when you are loved as much as you are? How can you be lonely?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you not know what it is to be lonely in a marriage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I do now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: married my brother's widow because my father ordered it. As a duty. To keep the alliance with Spain. And she is a remarkable woman. And wife. HENRY looks at MARY..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I never looked at her or longed for her the way I do you. HENRY reaches out. Their hands meet..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imagine how different it might have been. For both of us..had we been able to chose for ourselves.. HENRY leans forward and they kiss. Gently at first. MARY resisting. Then harder.. ensing this, the KING picks MARY up and leads her to the canopied bed, and lays her down.. They begin to make love. As radical a contrast to the sce WILLIAM CAREY as it is possible to imagine.. MARY's eyes open. She gasps. Her hands grip the sheets..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 53 HENRY and MARY, entwined in one another's arms, as the su rises...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 54 Several hours later: WILLIAM STAFFORD is fast asleep in a window seat in the c outside. Finally, the door opens. And MARY emerges from t KING's apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: S
dialogues.text: TAFFORD jumps to his feet. Waking rapidly..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have orders to bring you to your father. MARY stares at STAFFORD. As he straightens his shirt..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father..? a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we'd better not keep him waiting. STAFFORD turns, leads the way. MARY follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 55 The DUKE of NORFOLK's dogs are eating breakfast out of bo the fire. Slurping hungrily. The entire family is gathered. SIR THOMAS, LADY ELIZABETH present is WILLIAM CAREY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well..? MARY stares at her husband..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he have you? MARY's eyes burn..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than once? MARY stares daggers..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd better get used to talking about it. Once you sleep with the king, it's not a private matter any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. More than once. WILLIAM CAREY's face: a flicker of pain..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he was satisfied?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe so, Uncle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ood. This is where our work begins. It's one thing to catch the king. Quite another to keep him. NORFOLK turns to SIR THOMAS, ignoring MARY as though she piece of livestock..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to keep her spotless, hair washed every day. She must read all the latest books and be able to venture and defend an interesting opinion. She must know her music, must be energetic and entertaining - in company and in bed. That's how he likes his women. And if ever she's in any doubt as to how to conduct herself, or what to do next - she should simply watch the Queen. That woman kept him from straying for eleven years. And the effort almost killed her. ut SIR THOMAS has not heard. He is distracted. He watches a palace window as, in a stableyard down below.. GEORGE and FRANCIS WESTON return from riding together. Th of laughter as they dismount, and hand their horses to th stable-boys.. SIR THOMAS watches as GEORGE and FRANCIS walk back to the together. There's something in their manner, the intimacy between them.. SIR THOMAS's smile fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 56 `Slap', HENRY spreads out a huge architect's drawing of a magnificent ship on a table. He sits with SIR THOMAS BOLE the DUKE of NORFOLK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The biggest warship in the fleet. Thirty- two guns and two hundred feet long, and with your permission Thomas.. (We notice SIR THOMAS's clothes have become more expensive, grander)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..I'd like to name her after your daughter. The "Mary Boleyn". SIR THOMAS looks up in disbelief..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Majesty! I'm...I'm speechless..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: onsense. She's an angel. It's the least she deserves. And if there's anything else I can do for YOU, my friend..as an expression of my gratitude..let me know. SIR THOMAS's tails off. Thinking.. S SIR THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: s it happens..there is one thing. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name it. SIR THOMAS has clearly not stopped thinking about what he between GEORGE and FRANCIS WESTON.. SIR THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ur son, George. He's of an age now.. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to make him a match? SIR THOMAS bows. Deadly serious.. SIR THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, your Majesty. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have anyone in mind? SIR THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is one lady, Sir.. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on.. SIR THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who I fear is too high-born for us. And following the unfortunate matter between Anne and Henry Percy, I didn't want my children to overreach themselves again.. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: verreach themselves? HENRY can't help smiling.. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One is currently in the King's bed. If they are good enough for me, I suggest they're good enough for anyone else. So.. (gestures) Who is it? OVER THIS: we hear GEORGE's distraught voice..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane Parker..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 57 GEORGE BOLEYN, visibly shocked and distressed, stands in of his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg you, Father. No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's well connected, her father is cousin to the King. And there's money, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But must I actually...marry her? SIR THOMAS's expression changes..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: thought you had ambitions for this family.      G

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that you wish to make a contribution yourself. Not just stand back and watch your sisters. EORGE nods..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then my advice would be to start behaving like a man. A real man. Do I make myself clear? SIR THOMAS walks out. GEORGE stares after him..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 58 MUSICIANS play. We're at GEORGE's wedding. Attended by th and QUEEN, all the senior LORDS. It's a markedly grander posher affair than MARY's earlier wedding, a clear indica the BOLEYNS' new, elevated status.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A formation dance is in progress. At the centre of it: GE dances with a radiant, triumphant JANE PARKER. GEORGE's e meet those of FRANCIS WESTON across the room. y contrast: HENRY dances with MARY. A couple with eyes on each other. Locked to one another. Blissfully unaware of uninterested in anyone else. Silently counting the minute before they can tear off one another's clothes..

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL
dialogues.text: Their intimacy is witnessed by WILLIAM CAREY, who we noti now drinking heavily, drowning his jealous sorrows..

dialogues.speaker: ELSEWHERE
dialogues.text: SIR THOMAS BOLEYN is dancing with his wife, LADY ELIZABET hisses through a fixed smile.. SIR THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For God's sake, it's the wedding of our youngest child attended by the King of England and the greatest Lords in the Land. Would a smile be too much to ask? LADY ELIZABETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's to smile about? I'm a mother with one child on his wedding day looking like he's been condemned to death. he indicates GEORGE, who dances with JANE PARKER.. LADY ELIZABETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another banished abroad, in disgrace. And a third whoring in public with an adulterer. SIR THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the moment she's happy. SIR THOMAS watches MARY who dances with the KING.. LADY ELIZABETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But will she be happy when he leaves her? Because you know that's how it will end. SIR THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only God knows how anything will end. LADY ELIZABETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God..? He turned his back on all this a long time ago. SIR THOMAS stares coldly at his wife. He applauds as the comes to an end.

dialogues.speaker: IN ANOTHER CORNER
dialogues.text: MARY and the KING also clap. HENRY whispers sexily in MAR ear. She laughs. Then HENRY is called to one side... MARY is momentarily left alone. She looks up to see WILLI CAREY standing in front of her, swaying slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in love with him, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: illiam, you're drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is it? With him? MARY stares - suddenly hard - punishing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pleases me. Is that what you want to hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does he do to you? Tell me. I want to know.. MARY pulls away. But CAREY pulls her roughly to one side. sees this from across the room..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you look at me with contempt. But I had no choice. Your father insisted I stand aside. What was I expected to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say `no', husband. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was all you had to do. MARY pulls her arm away, and goes. She walks across the r visibly shaken, and joins the KING. 5

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 9 HENRY and MARY make love. Two people giving everything of themselves.. Hours later: they lie together, enveloped in one another' MARY is awake. The King asleep in her arms. She lovingly his hair. Watches him breathe. Her face is glowing. Content. And the look in her eyes te more eloquently and unequivocally than any sonnet..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...that she has fallen in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 60 The sound of groaning. Wretching. Shooting through a half door, we see MARY hunched over her basin, vomiting.

dialogues.speaker: P
dialogues.text: resently, she emerges from the bathroom. White-faced. Her instinctively covering her belly. MARY's eyes widen with the implications.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 61 SIR THOMAS BOLEYN and the DUKE of NORFOLK stare at MARY. present are several PHYSICIANS and GEORGE BOLEYN..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you certain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. SIR THOMAS looks at the PHYSICIAN, who nods..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: n that case...I suppose...someone should tell the King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 62 Shooting through a half-open door.. SIR THOMAS and the DUKE of NORFOLK are having a private a with the KING. SIR THOMAS whispers something in HENRY's e (WE DO NOT HEAR THE WORDS - WE DO NOT NEED TO). HENRY's face breaks out in a smile. He delightedly shakes THOMAS's hand. OVER THIS: the sound of a voice..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep them shut...still shut..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 63 A blindfolded MARY is led through doors by SIR THOMAS..in suite of grand, unfurnished rooms, the most prestigious accommodation at court..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now open! MARY removes her blindfold. She gasps in disbelief, turns degrees, staring at the size, and grandeur of the locatio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's more. Thanks to you, I am to become an Earl. Your brother a Viscount. EORGE smiles at MARY, who's eyes widen.. SIR THOMAS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In addition, we have received a number of new grants and estates. pointedly, to LADY ELIZABETH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So our debts are paid off. But LADY ELIZABETH remains granite-faced..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just be aware. These `gifts', this `favour' can go as swiftly as it comes. These rooms belonged to the Duke of Buckingham. Once the King's closest friend. Now his head rots on a spike..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he committed treason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what is `treason'? It's anything the King or his lawyers decide it to be. Anything that offends him, or causes him displeasure. a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And can you assure me we'll never do that? LADY ELIZABETH turns and walks out. MARY looks anxiously THOMAS, who gestures dismissively..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pay her no heed..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 64 MARY wakes up. She gets out of bed. She goes to the windo draws the curtains. Then MARY looks down, and gasps. The floor has fresh drop blood on it. MARY goes to her bed, and rips back the sheets. Her eyes in horror. There is blood all over the sheets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY covers her mouth. Lets out a loud cry. The sound of approaching footsteps as SERVANTS come running..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 65 MARY lies on the bed being examined by several PHYSICIANS THOMAS and the DUKE of NORFOLK look on in concern. Finall PHYSICIAN turns, washing his hands..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happily, the baby lives. She's not miscarried.

dialogues.speaker: S
dialogues.text: SIR THOMAS's face. Overcome with relief..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the placenta is weak. For the sake of the child.. The PHYSICIAN clears his throat. This will not be easy..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She must begin her lying-in immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (horrified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? MARY looks up. Her heart sinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm only three months.. 66

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY lies in her bed, watching with a forlorn expression MIDWIVES and MAIDS prepare the apartment for lying-in. APESTRIES with soothing biblical images are hung on the w CURTAINS are drawn for darkness. A large CRUCIFIX is plac corner. As each TAPESTRY is hung, the room becomes darker... ..and darker. ..and darker. MARY cranes her neck to remain in sunlight for as long as possible, but before long.. ..her face slips into darkness, and the room into total s And effective imprisonment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 67 Darkness. The KING stands at the foot of MARY's bed. He i clearly uncomfortable in these `maternal' surroundings..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ou poor girl. All alone in here. But the time will fly by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will it? It's six months?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But the most important thing is a healthy child. ENRY takes MARY's hand.. HENRY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll come and see you as often as I can. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: ENRY kisses MARY, then goes. 8

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The KING's birthday. The MASTER OF REVELS has organised a ball. The entire court is assembled and dancing, but HENR appears sullen, distant. Unable to celebrate. He misses MARY. he QUEEN has several of her prettiest SPANISH LADIES-IN W surrounding the KING. Giggling, fragrant butterflies. But HENRY shows no interest. The DUKE of NORFOLK notices this. A flicker of concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 69 An archery competition is in progress. But HENRY pays no attention. He sits listlessly to one side. Ill-tempered a missing MARY. mong the GUESTS are SIR JOHN SEYMOUR and his CHILDREN. Th notice the KING, all alone. They talk among themselves. Sensing an opportunity, SIR JOHN SEYMOUR advances, and pr his pretty daughter JANE to the KING. The DUKE of NORFOLK, (never far away), notices how modest demurely young JANE SEYMOUR flirts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has been well trained. But she makes no impact on HENRY. He waves the SEYMOURS a Not remotely interested. or the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 70 The KING is visiting MARY. He sits by her bed. They hold and are talking intimately.

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: This is being watched by the DUKE of NORFOLK, and SIR THO BOLEYN. NORFOLK's face is dark and brooding..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
