dialogues.text: For the moment he's still visiting Mary. But for how long? The Queen will soon have his head spinning with pretty little Spanish things. Not to mention the Seymours with that girl of theirs. NORFOLK looks up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What we need is someone from OUR family who will keep the King focused on Mary, reminding him of her while she is absent. SIR THOMAS is about to speak, then changes his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Speak..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just...I was going to suggest Anne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't control that girl last time. What makes you think it would be any different now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had favourable reports from the Dowager Queen in France. It seems she is quite changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 71 MARY sits up. Her eyes widen in horror..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Sitting beside her in the darkness, is her brother GEORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose they felt three years of exile was punishment enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the King visits me every day. There's no need for her. Or anyone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just want to protect you. Leave nothing to chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But in who's interests do they imagine Anne will act? Certainly not mine. GEORGE turns, looks all around him.. GEORGE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why DO they make this room such a dungeon? Does it really need to be this dark? GEORGE notices MARY's vexed expression..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. She's had three years to forgive you. And she's not going to risk being sent away again. She'll do as she's told, I'm sure. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, the most important thing is.. GEORGE moves MARY's lips into an upward shape..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three of us will be together again. MARY's lips: a reluctant, unconvincing smile..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 72 The thunder of galloping horses. alf a dozen RIDERS, among them a HOODED WOMAN, riding sid saddle, tearing across the countryside..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 73 The RIDERS and the WOMAN gallop through villages, sprayin VILLAGERS stop and stare.. A MOTHER pulls a child out of the path of the RIDERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 74 The RIDERS and the WOMAN ride in silhouette against a per full moon..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 75 HENRY and several of his COURTIERS return from a hunting Several dead STAGS are carried on horseback. The atmosphe celebratory. It's been a good day. Dogs bark in excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 76 A dinner at court. HENRY is at one end, in serious conver with foreign AMBASSADORS. Presently, at the other end of table, loud laughter.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: ENRY looks up, then returns to his conversation. It's not long before another loud gale of laughter in the of the room. HENRY looks up again. Then returns to his conversation. resently, a third roar of laughter at the other end. This HENRY loses patience..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the noise? I can hardly hear myself think! At the other end, a COURTIER gets to his feet..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Mistress Boleyn, your Majesty. Her stories about life at the French court. They are particularly amusing. HENRY's expression changes. The room falls silent..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm only aware of one Boleyn girl and she is lying-in with a certain child in her belly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIR THOMAS BOLEYN gets to his feet.. SIR THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my elder daughter, Anne, your Majesty. She has returned to court. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? That awful girl, Thomas? The one that almost killed me? (a beat) You allowed her back? SIR THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The time abroad has done her good, your Majesty. I'm certain you'd find her much improved. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really..? HENRY looks down the table.. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, come on. Where are you, other Boleyn girl? Show your face. ANNE slowly gets to her feet. HENRY looks up. When he see ANNE's face, his face falls.. ANNE is a woman transformed. Gone are the simple clothes, fat and lack of confidence. ANNE has become a glorious, head-turning siren; dressed i daring French clothes. er hood is half-crescent, and reveals the hair. Her neckl plunges sexily. Her sleeves are long and loose, offering flashes of arm and elbow.. Like every other red-blooded MAN in the room, HENRY is ut mesmerised. Speechless.. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? What is so amusing, Anne? Perhaps we might hear and judge for ourselves? ANNE dark, intelligent eyes stare back at HENRY. Suddenly sound fades, and the world shrinks around them: it's as t they are the only two people in the room.. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just giving my thoughts on the new French King. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which are..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That for someone with such great wealth, and power..he has surprisingly little authority as a man. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hah! ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And is SO consumed by one particular rivalry he can barely think. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: eally? And who is this rival? ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A neighbouring King, who's name one is forbidden to mention at court. Whose reputation haunts him in his thoughts and dreams. ipples of laughter, as people guess.. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose armies and navy thwart his every endeavour. Whose physical and intellectual endowments are known far and wide. ENRY laughs too. Enjoying this.. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In order to restore his confidence, this French King spends a fortune on anything that glitters, on building of castles with large towers.. ANNE artfully gestures the phallic implications.. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But these symbols of wealth and virility fail to convince. Talk among the ladies at court in France suggests..

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: ANNE stops herself... HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That in this department too, the King has his shortcomings. ANNE's gesture, (discreetly wiggling her small finger). H stares for a moment. A deathly silence. Has she gone too

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then HENRY smiles. Delighted. DOGS bark in bewilderment. everyone in the room laughs too. xcept for the SEYMOURS, (SIR JOHN and his sons, EDWARD an THOMAS), who glower, mute, at the end of the table beside sister JANE..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 77 SIR THOMAS beams with excitement and satisfaction...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have seen the Seymours! Their faces! MARY lies in bed. Sitting by her side is her father..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They must have thought that with you out of the way, they had a real opportunity with that pale-faced thing of theirs, Jane... SIR THOMAS smiles as he remembers.. SIR THOMAS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Anne put pay to that. Last night, the King only had eyes for us Boleyns. MARY shoots a private, knowing look..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or HER, you mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'm wary of any suggestion that Anne would serve anyone but herself. France can't have changed her THAT much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: n this occasion I am quite satisfied she was being loyal to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? MARY stares hollow-eyed.. MARY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then ask yourself this. If she is really so concerned for my well-being... (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...then why hasRY(conot dcome to see me MA she nt' )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: since she returned?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 78 HENRY and several of his closest COURTIERS are sparring c combat sword fighting. It's tough, physical, no-holds bar stuff..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 9 AFTERWARDS: HENRY and his COURTIERS, (among them GEORGE), being undressed and washed by their PAGES and SQUIRES..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a fortunate man, George. To be blessed with G two such sisters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, my Lord. There is a powerful physicality, a sexual confidence to H which he exudes, even among men. He moves closer to GEORG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me. Are they as different in temper as they are in looks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. Each has her own, quite distinct virtues. Mary for example..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm familiar with Mary's. Tell me about Anne's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne? Well, she's strong. Some might say `difficult'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Headstrong. With a fiery temper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But with it comes great passion, too. It's both the best and the worst thing about her. a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no half measures with Anne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful, you'll make me think I chose the wrong Boleyn girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. I'm certain Mary is the   right choice. You will have a serene,   happy, life with her. The risk is with   Anne, it might be like being caught in a   wild summer storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that so..? GEORGE has tried to put HENRY off. But might just have sa wrong thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: storm, you say..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 0 A small, precious-looking GIFT BOX sits on a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the King, madam. ANNE looks at the box. Her heart misses a beat. It carrie unmistakable royal seal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open it. A SERVANT stares..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said `open it.' The SERVANT opens it. Other SERVANTS crane their necks, s tiptoes. Inside is a large pearl pendant. The SERVANT gas ANNE, too. Covers her mouth. It's beautiful.. But from somewhere, she manages to find the strength..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now close it again. And send it back. The SERVANT stares in disbelief.. ANNE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me. The SERVANT bows, and leaves, taking the box. ANNE watche look of mischief in her eyes. She's up to no good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 81 The SERVANT nervously stands in front of the KING, holdin box..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She did what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sent it back, your Grace. HENRY's face. Confounded..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sent it back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 82 A ROYAL MESSENGER, in the King's livery, holding a larger expensive looking GIFT BOX, walks towards the Boleyn hous

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 83 ANNE shakes her head, and sends the gift back. She looks anxious. Knows this is a high risk game she's playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 84 The MESSENGER stands in front of the KING, holding the re BOX in his hands..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 85 The same ROYAL MESSENGER walks towards the BOLEYN house. time holding an even larger, more expensive-looking GIFT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 86 Again, ANNE shakes her head, and sends the gift back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 7 The KING is in a meeting with several AMBASSADORS on an important matter. The doors open. He looks up to see.. .the MESSENGER returning with the latest GIFT. HENRY's sm fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 88 `Crash', the KING, flanked by several of his most intimid COURTIERS, bursts through doors, and storms along a corri It's an impressive sight.. People scatter to get out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 89 The KING bursts in. Everyone leaps to their feet. SERVANT and stare and curtsey. LADY ELIZABETH bows, clearly throw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Majesty. HENRY turns full circle, looking for someone..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your daughter. Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 90 ANNE hears the KING's voice. Her eyes widen. She looks do Sees HENRY. ANNE smiles privately - it's confirmation tha strategy has worked. t that moment, HENRY sees her, calls out, `Anne!'. ANNE's fades. ENRY dashes up the stairs..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 91 ANNE, who is not properly dressed for the KING, rushes ba her room. HENRY follows. ANNE closes the door..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne..       A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hurriedly dressing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Grace? They speak through the door..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You received my gifts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And? They did not please you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the contrary, my Lord. They pleased me greatly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why did you return them? Now ANNE opens the door. She appears wearing a stunning o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 92 ANNE steps into the corridor. Closes the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ecause my sister lies in bed with your child. If you wish to please me, Sir, then send her the gifts you send me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have shown Mary enough kindness and generosity. It's you I want, Anne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: beg you, my Lord, do not do this. What has changed so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU. Don't you see? YOU have changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Mary is still the mother of your child. And even if she weren't..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could I forget that you chose her above me when we first met? You liked her better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not true..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either way, I could never betray my own sister..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat) NE(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I beg you, leave me. This is too difficult to bear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see! The same pain as mine! It proves you feel the same way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps. But since it can never come to anything..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me decide that. For now, you have given me hope.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: ENRY goes on bended knee, kisses her hand, and goes. ANNE left alone. She breathes out. Then looks down at her hand hey are shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY is asleep. Dead of night. Suddenly she wakes up, and her stomach, `Ouch!'. It's the first contraction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 94 SIR THOMAS is asleep. The sound of voices. A commotion ou The sound of banging on his door..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir Thomas! It's Mary..!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 5 MARY cries out in pain. The contractions become stronger. MIDWIVES and PHYSICIANS urgently do their business. Pots boiling water. Primitive surgical instruments. PRIEST arrives, ready to perform the last rites..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 96 The DUKE of NORFOLK, SIR THOMAS, and GEORGE BOLEYN arrive MARY's bedroom, and stare anxiously as the labour begins earnest..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does the King know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on his way. ANNE, who overhears this, surreptitiously adjusts her dre MARY screams in agony. The labour is well and truly under Medically, it's a primitive, brutal affair.. No comprehension of sterilisation. MIDWIVES have dirty ha PHYSICIANS use rusty, blood-stained instruments.. Presently: the KING arrives with several COURTIERS.. SIR THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any moment, your Grace. But the KING hasn't heard. He has seen ANNE. Suddenly, it if all sound, all vision disappears, except for ANNE. He beside her.. All around them the violence and dramatic activity of the unfolding; but for all their connection with it, HENRY an might as well be in a rose garden.. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne.. ANNE stares ahead at MARY's bed.. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne, I love you.. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Grace, this is not the time.. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you Anne. I cannot stop thinking about you. I cannot eat, I cannot sleep.. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how could I ever TRUST you? NORFOLK cranes his neck to listen.. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I have seen how you have betrayed first your wife. And now my sister. HENRY takes ANNE to one side... HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I vow from this moment forth I will never lie with my wife, or speak to your sister again. I will do anything you ask..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY's contractions build. Birth is imminent. PHYSICIANS MIDWIVES work to deliver the baby. ANNE thinks, then.. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then don't acknowledge the child. HENRY is thrown.. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? With a blood-curdling scream, MARY finally gives birth. S THOMAS and NORFOLK crowd into the room, anxious to see.. PHYSICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A boy! SIR THOMAS turns towards HENRY, beaming with happiness.. SIR THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a boy, your Majesty. A strong, healthy boy. HENRY's face: a boy? His eyes fill with emotion. This is has waited for. A son. ANNE notices his conflict, and prompts him again.. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What my sister has given you, I could, too. HENRY looks at the BABY, then turns to face ANNE. His eye full of conflict, then..he silently nods. ANNE's face breaks out in a smile.. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well. Then, in front of everyone, not caring how inappropriate HENRY falls to his knee, takes ANNE's hand and kisses it. The audible sound of gasps. MARY watches in horror as HEN falls to his knees and kisses ANNE's hand.. M MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a dagger in her heart) Henry..? HENRY gets to his feet, then turns and walks away without looking in the direction of MARY or the BABY. MARY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Lord..? MARY stares after the KING, but he does not turn around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instead, MARY's eyes meet ANNE's. ANNE's eyes stare back. The ultimate moment of revenge. barely perceptible smile of satisfaction, then ANNE turns goes. The MIDWIVES and PHYSICIANS stare at one another, visibly embarrassed by what they have just witnessed. The clearing of throats, averting of eyes. Then they get their work to the sound of the MARY's cries..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 97 `Crash', SIR THOMAS and NORFOLK burst into the study, ang slamming the door closed behind them. ANNE is inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn you! Three years we've been working on this! Not a single detail was left to chance! And now, in the moment of our greatest glory.. NORFOLK stares at ANNE..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I can say is you'd better have a plan. And it had better work. ANNE stares back defiantly..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or what...Uncle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it! Both of you. What shall we do about Mary? And the child? Or have we forgotten them already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary should go back to her husband. Not a flicker of emotion on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has been inconvenienced long enough by this family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Then you can be the one to tell her. ADY ELIZABETH stares at ANNE..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you've earned that privilege. LADY ELIZABETH turns and walks out. ANNE's smile fades. 9

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 8 MARY lies in bed. She looks pale. Exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 9 ANNE stares into the room through a crack in the doorway. A flicker of doubt. What has she done? To her own sister? ANNE checks herself. Enough sentiment. She swallows it. nd enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 00 MARY looks up as ANNE enters, and freezes..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you show your face in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand you're angry - but be assured. I did nothing, except remind him of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, spare me. You did this deliberately. As revenge. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now you have what you wanted you probably think justice has been done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, hasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful, that's my advice. Learn from my experience. Because he'll only do to you what he has done to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never. I'll make sure he understands I'm a greater thing by far. That he can never have me until he makes me a far greater offer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll never get Henry Percy back, if that's what you mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what I mean. ANNE's eyes burn with anger..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't you ever mention his name to me again. I'll never forget how you betrayed me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that's what you think, fine. Tell yourself that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did, sister. Every day for three years. ANNE turns, and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 101 MARY is leaving COURT. Pale. Weak. Her belongings have be packed into boxes. Ahead of her, the BABY is being carrie MIDWIVES, led by WILLIAM STAFFORD. MARY walks across a courtyard, then stops in her tracks. VER BY THE STABLES: the KING and ANNE are mounting horses riding together. HENRY lifts ANNE up into the saddle behi (how she has learned!). ANNE holds tight, her arms wrappe around his waist.. At that moment, ANNE looks over and sees MARY. Their eyes They stare for a beat, then.. ANNE kicks HENRY's horse, `Hah!', and they ride out. Gall into the distance. MARY's face: fighting to hold onto her dignity. WILLIAM S watches her, his eyes burning with sympathy. REVERSE ANGLE: to reveal, this is all being watched by QU KATHERINE, from a palace window above.. QUEEN KATHERINE turns, and coldly lets the curtain drop..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 102 MARY and her entourage travel through the countryside in caravan of horses and wagons. It's raining heavily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 103 The rain continues. MARY's carriage approaches the manor At one time this was everything she wanted. Now it's a pr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 104 MARY sits at the dinner table with her husband, WILLIAM C who's health has deteriorated. He drinks heavily. A shado his former self. He stares at the BABY..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you christened the child?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. A painful smile..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And is he to take my name? Or is he to be a Fitzroy or some other sign that he is a royal bast...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is to be Henry Carey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. A silence, then..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then, here we are. WILLIAM stares at MARY. Clearly still in love with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could pretend none of this ever happened. Start again. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you could. MARY's face. Manages a brave smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 105 MARY lies in bed, her eyes open and staring blankly at th outside, as WILLIAM CAREY makes love to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a short, frenzied thrashing..he climaxes, then as b rolls over and falls asleep. MARY stares at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 106 Gorgeous sunshine. Greenwich Palace at it's most beautifu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 107 HENRY and ANNE walk through the gardens. Out of earshot o entire court which is assembled outside..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I have done what you asked. Will you give yourself to me, now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My one true mistress. To whom I am loyal above all others?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's not true. You are loyal to the QUEEN above all others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife? I barely see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she sits on a throne beside you. Accompanies you to every state function.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For appearance sakes only. In every other regard, our marriage is a sham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still, she is your WIFE. And ever present. And I feel her eyes on me. And those of her spies. ANNE nervously looks left and right..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And look at us. Forever reduced to meeting in secret like this. Speaking in whispers. a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardly conducive to passion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what would you have me do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 108 ANNE watches from a distance as HENRY talks to WOLSEY. We hear their dialogue, but the two MEN are having a heated discussion. Voices are raised. WOLSEY pleads with the KING to be reasonable. HENRY silen angrily, then walks out..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 109 ANNE enters a lavish drawing-room, and sits down. She pic book, and pretends to be reading. HENRY enters, sidles up ANNE, putting his arms around her, then..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolsey has agreed to draw up plans for the Queen to be sent to a nunnery. HENRY kisses ANNE on the neck..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She will protest, of course. She won't go quietly, but she knows she has failed to give me a son, and deserves her exile. HENRY kisses ANNE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which leaves you all alone at court.. He begins to unbutton her dress..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...queen in all but name. Mother to any future heir. ENRY unbuttons and kisses lower, lower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, is this assurance enough? Will you give yourself to me now? A flicker behind ANNE's eyes, then..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to. But I'm afraid I find the insult too much to bear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What insult?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because as long as we remain unmarried, any child I gave you would forever be daubed `bastard' and I a `whore'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ut what alternative is there? throws hands up in exasperation)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My love for the Queen may have died, but even you must concede, she is still very much alive. A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine of Aragon is alive. That woman is not worthy of the title `Queen'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Anne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really do not know why we waste time talking of convents when you could annul the marriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annul it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That woman married two brothers and therefore sinned against God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she never consummated the marriage with my brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were married six months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur was a sick man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Katherine is a shrewd woman who knew that her position as Queen would never be safe until she bedded your brother. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to your advisers. They will tell you as much. ANNE walks out. HENRY stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 110 ANNE sits in her study working. HENRY appears in the door His face is dark. Conflicted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolsey has agreed to charge the Queen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's wonderful. ANNE's smiles, then notices..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you look sad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because she will contest it. Which means putting her on trial. And hearing these delicate matters in public.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: es. But any court made up of YOUR Bishops will surely find in YOUR favour. And declare the marriage invalid. Now it's ANNE's turn to start kissing HENRY round the nec

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hen you, my sweet Lord, will be free to remarry. (sensing his arousal)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I can give myself to you fully. kissing him lower, lower..)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And give you everything you.. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..desire. ANNE stops, leaving HENRY highly aroused..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 111 It's mid-winter. A lone RIDER appears on the snowy crest hill looking down on Rochford Hall. t's WILLIAM STAFFORD, (now bearded). He kicks his horse. down towards the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 112 A fire roars. STAFFORD warms himself, staring at MARY's n daughter, (CATHERINE), in a a cot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought gifts from your family. A night-dress from your mother. (to YOUNG HENRY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This from your Uncle George. STAFFORD produces a small wooded sword from behind his ba Little HENRY takes the sword. Swooshes it with excitement

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please be sure to thank them - though one wonders what's kept them so busy that not a single one of them found time to visit the new baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Anne. She's turning this country on its head. She has persuaded the king to test the validity of his marriage, and put the QueenM on trial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues to hold out. Expertly witholding her favours until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..until what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until he makes her the ultimate offer. MARY's eyes widen..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High stakes indeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 113 MARY follows STAFFORD out to the stables where freshly wa and fed horses are waiting..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And my brother George?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Continues to be promoted. As does your Father. I lost track of their latest titles. STAFFORD smiles. Mounts his horse..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ow is your husband? I heard he was unwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. STAFFORD stares at her. Their eyes meet. STAFFORD opens h mouth, for a moment it looks as if he's about to finally his feelings, then..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary..! WILLIAM CAREY's voice calls out from inside. STAFFORD's expression changes. Now's not the right time. He kicks his horse, and rides off. 114

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILLIAM CAREY lying in bed, emaciated, coughing blood, we sick, calls out for help, `Mary!' 115

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY walks down a corridor towards her husband's bedroom. goes, she passes a window. She stops. And looks out. In the distance is WILLIAM STAFFORD's horse. Reaching the of a hill..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 116 At that precise moment, WILLIAM STAFFORD's horse reaches of the hill..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling horse up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa.. STAFFORD turns, and faces back down at the house. He take last look. For a moment there is a connection between the hen, he turns, and kicks his horse, and rides over the br

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 117 MARY watches him go, then stops - catches herself feeling something for the first time. Then she turns and walks al corridor.. ..back in the direction of WILLIAM CAREY's coughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 118 A hall filled with LAWYERS and AMBASSADORS from both side Arguably the grandest, most significant divorce proceedin history. ANNE watches from a distance as HENRY talks to CARDINAL W Then HENRY turns. He walks towards ANNE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Queen has insisted a Papal representative be present at the trial. But Wolsey has assured me the trial will proceed for appearance sake only. We have our verdict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what troubles you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One or two friends have refused to lend their support. Among them, Thomas More. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then there's the small matter of my conscience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? You have justice on your side. HENRY stares, conflicted..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I? ANNE strokes his head. Pacifying him. But the look on her tells us - this is getting harder and harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 119 HENRY sits at breakfast. Reading official correspondence. documents. And private letters. e sorts through the various scrolls, matters of state, th finds one. A letter in a hand he does not recognise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quizzical look. HENRY cracks the seal and begins to rea letter. Presently, his expression changes. Then his face darkens ominously. His knuckles whiten..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 120 SIR THOMAS and the DUKE of NORFOLK storm down a corridor. faces are grim. It's a terrifying sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 21 `Crash', the door flies open. SIR THOMAS and NORFOLK burs ANNE is in the bath. She covers herself..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Mary Talbot'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Talbot!! The girl that married Henry Percy. It seems she has petitioned the King, demanding a divorce from her husband( on the grounds.. he can hardly bring himself to say the words)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...that his prior betrothal to you was actually.. (his knuckles whiten)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..consummated. ANNE's eyes widen in horror..`What?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew this would come back to haunt us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must go to the King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! He doesn't want to see you! Or hear a word from your lips! He's far too angry. a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems the only Boleyn he will speak to, the only person who's testimony he will trust in this matter.. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...is Mary. ANNE's face. A dagger in her heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 122 A cemetery in mid-winter. WILLIAM CAREY's coffin is lower the ground. MARY, dressed in window's black, steps forwar a shovel, throws earth on the grave. MARY walks back to comfort the CHILDREN. The elderly PRIE continues with the service. MARY bows her head. Then she senses someone's eyes are on She looks up, and her expression changes.. There is GEORGE. Her brother. Standing among the handful mourners. Staring at her. 23

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire BOLEYN family is assembled. SIR THOMAS, LADY ELIZABETH, the DUKE of NORFOLK, GEORGE and, at the centre proceedings, ANNE herself. The atmosphere is tense. Presently, the door opens, and M enters the room. In widow's weeds. All eyes on her. And h CHILDREN. A sharp intake of breath, a ripple of shock at state of them. In simple country clothes. MARY curtseys..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary. n awkward silence. MARY holds her CHILDREN's hands..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're so sorry. clears throat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About your husband..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 124 Several MAIDS are assembled, fussing over MARY. Transform from penniless country widow to sophisticated courtier ag

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: ANNE enters, (unseen by MARY), and ushers everyone out. S takes the brush from the departing SERVANT, and continues brush MARY's hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: uch beautiful hair. earing ANNE's voice, MARY freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for coming. MARY looks up. Notices ANNE's hands are shaking..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate how this matter has come between us. I wanted to come to see you after your daughter was born, and again when your husband died, but..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine. MARY pulls away. Raises her hand..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me. Please..? ANNE stares at MARY, her lips trembling..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm frightened, Mary. What have I done? MARY turns away. Avoids ANNE's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 125 The KING sits in his private apartment. He looks up as MA enters, and curtseys deeply. Seeing MARY, his DOG enthusiastically greets her. Lapping at her. MARY looks at the KING. She is overcome with emotion, but the strength to hide it..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah! Mary! Come in. MARY walks closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closer.. (beckons)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into the light. MARY walks closer. HENRY looks at her..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Other Boleyn Girl. I'd forgotten how beautiful you were. MARY looks at him. Something has changed in him. A percep darkness around the eyes. A sadness..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ou asked to see me, your Grace?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 126 The BOLEYN FAMILY members are pacing outside. Anxious. AN SIR THOMAS exchange looks. FINALLY: the door opens. MARY emerges from the King's apartments. er entire FAMILY stares expectantly at her. ANNE steps fo barely able to conceal her anxiety..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And..? 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 27 MARY is putting the children to bed, tucking YOUNG HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama? What's the matter? MARY's face: visibly upset. Her hands shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting brave face on)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. MARY smiles, tenderly kisses YOUNG HENRY. ANNE appears in the doorway. Watches through a half-open Notes how loving MARY is as a mother.. MARY gets to her feet. Walks towards ANNE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 128 MARY closes the door behind her. ANNE stares at her, then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with difficulty)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am forever in your debt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You owe me nothing, sister. I did it that we may finally draw a line beneath everything that has happened between us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hen let it be exactly that. A new start between us. Here at court. ANNE embraces MARY, who stiffens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. But I'd rather go back to our home in the country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? That damp old ruin? With no food? Or warmth? a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you let your family look after you? Your children would have the best of everything here. They would grow up safe and secure. MARY stares, horrified. But before she can reply... The sound of a commotion, from outside. The sound of trum The unmistakable noise of arriving SOLDIERS. veryone rushes to a window. Looks down to see a small ARM t the centre of everything: an grand, old, bearded ARCHBI climbs down from an opulent carriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ho's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Papal Legate. Sent by the Pope to preside over the Queen's trial. MARY looks first at ANNE, then back out as the long proce dramatically enters the Palace Gates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, it's true. It's really happening? ANNE suddenly looks pale. Vulnerable. Frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is. Stay with me, please? I need my sister by me side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 29 A huge crowd is assembled. Despite the intimidating prese the KING's GUARDS, the people shout vigorously in support QUEEN KATHERINE. Crying out her name. The QUEEN arrives. ast cheers go up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 130 We're in a packed courtroom. The room is filled with the country's highest-ranking bishops. To one side: ANNE and watch from behind a screen..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY hears the CROWD's cheering for the QUEEN. Screams of support and affection, `Long live Queen Katherine', `Our true Queen'. MARY looks anxious.. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowds are with her. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowds have no vote. a beat) And the bishops that do are in Wolsey's pocket. ANNE watches as KATHERINE enters court. The QUEEN sees AN starts walking directly towards them.. ANNE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, she's coming towards us. QUEEN KATHERINE walks towards the screen, reaches it, the Q

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pushes it aside, intimidatingly flanked by her LAWYERS.. UEEN KATHERINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So..the Boleyn whores. Two former ladies of mine. Hiding in shadows. (a beat) What did I do to upset you, that you should turn against me like this? ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You failed to give England an heir. QUEEN KATHERINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that upsets you so? ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What upsets the King upsets me. QUEEN KATHERINE straightens. Big mistake. QUEEN KATHERINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How dare you! CRIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Katherine, Queen of England, come into court..! KATHERINE's LAWYERS try to drag her away from ANNE, but s wrenches herself free.. QUEEN KATHERINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ou want me to creep away and become a nun? Well, I shall not. You want me to lie before God and admit my first marriage was consummated? Well, it was not. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: K

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me toUEEN KATHERINE(cont'd) Q retire and withdraw my

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: daughter's claim as sole rightful heir to the throne? Well I shall not. Not in a thousand years, not if you rack me to within an inch of my life... (beat) I am Katherine, Queen of England, the King's one true wife, and mother of the heir to the throne. Beloved of the people, and beloved of a King you have bewitched. KATHERINE turns and enters the packed courtroom. She make reply to the CRIER, instead walks over to where the KING and falls onto her knees.. MARY looks at ANNE, who is visibly shaking. And tries to herself. Throughout the courtroom, people exchange looks. Gasp. KA is completely disregarding the court, Campeggio and Wolse appealing directly to her husband.. KATHERINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Lord, how have I offended you? For twenty years, I have been a true, obedient wife. I have loved all those whom you loved, and given you children though it has pleased God to take them away. If there is any just cause that you can allege against me, I will happily depart to my shame and dishonour, but I tell you, as God is my witness, there is none. ENRY sits in silence, but can barely contain his rage. ATHERINE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I beg you, dear husband, to spare me this humiliation. But if you will not, and I am to be tried.. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defiant) You are. KATHERINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..then let it be in a proper court and by the only authority I recognise. His holiness himself. An audible gasp from the court. HENRY shoots a look at WO `What?!?' WOLSEY is horrified, `I know nothing of this.' KATHERINE gets to her feet, and dramatically walks out of court, stopping only to pause by a window..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cheers from the loyal PEOPLE who are waiting outside through the court. HENRY looks dark, thunderous. He storm of court. WOLSEY watches, visibly shaken...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since it has pleased the Queen to absent herself from the court, the trial will simply proceed without her. A LAWYER gets to his feet. The trial begins..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 131 The entire BOLEYN FAMILY is assembled. ANNE paces up and MARY is with her children..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolsey promised the King his verdict. Instead he has humiliated him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they are continuing with the trial. And the Bishops will still find in the King's favour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. But without the Pope's blessing, the result will seem hollow. a frustrated gesture)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If only the King would take matters into his own hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And do what? His only option would be to reject the Catholic Church? And his faith would never allow it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nor his good sense. Breaking with Rome would isolate England politically. Leave us at the mercy of the Protestants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the alternative is leaving this country without an heir. Failing in his duty as a King. And risking civil war. ANNE stops thinks.. ANNE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: S
dialogues.text: omehow I need to make him understand that it is a fair price for a legitimate heir. ANNE looks at MARY..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One he could hold in his arms.. ANNE's face: an idea forming.. ANNE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A strong, rosy-cheeked boy.. MARY looks up. Sees all eyes staring at her..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (becoming suspicious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 132 HENRY, along with THOMAS CROMWELL and several of his LAWY walking along a corridor. They turn a corner, then stop. HENRY freezes. He's seen something. And the impact of it made him stop in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL
dialogues.text: In the gardens outside, are ANNE and YOUNG HENRY, playing The KING's face: it's as if all sound goes silent. He sta transfixed, at the boy. He hears nothing except YOUNG HEN laughter. He sees nothing except YOUNG HENRY's golden loc MARY watches from a distance, her heart cracking as HENRY dismisses CROMWELL and the LAWYERS, and goes out to join and YOUNG HENRY. t seems to have a profound affect on him..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 133 HENRY walks towards ANNE. And bends so as not to frighten boy..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's this? ANNE smiles, maternally strokes the boy's hair..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, on..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it, now? A fine name. (raises eyebrow)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how old are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four, Sir. REVERSE ANGLE: to see MARY watching helplessly from insid palace. Tears are streaming down her face. LADY ELIZABETH appears, and puts her arm round MARY's shoulders in comfo OUTSIDE: in the gardens, YOUNG HENRY and his father conti get to know one another.. YOUNG HENRY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that sword real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so. Would you like to see it? HENRY draws it, and shows the boy, who's eyes widen in excitement..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, `on guard'. HENRY and YOUNG HENRY begin to play fight. As they do, ou CAMERA slowly, slowly pulls back to reveal.. The scene is being watched by: MARY, her nose pressed against a window in the palace, as continues to watch HENRY play with her SON..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 134 From a window high up, we notice: QUEEN KATHERINE has app too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 35 HENRY continues to play with the boy. It's clearly a powe emotional experience for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 36 Gradually, other FACES appear at the palace windows.. First SIR THOMAS's. Then NORFOLK's. Then MARY's. Finally QUEEN KATHERINE..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching on tenterhooks. Unsure how this will play out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 137 A clap of thunder. A storm breaks. Rain pours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 38 QUEEN KATHERINE, screaming in protest, surrounded by wail LADIES-IN-WAITING, is dragged roughly away from court by of ARMED GUARDS..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How dare you! (struggling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your hands off me.. The GUARDS drag the QUEEN away, her heart-breaking kickin screaming continues. As she disappears.. We REVERSE ANGLE TO REVEAL: this is being watched shadows KING himself.. His face: burning with guilt and self-loathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 139 The door flies open. ANNE is reading, alone. She looks up HENRY, his eyes ablaze..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you will give yourself to me. ANNE looks up..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I had made myself clear. Until we are married, there is no questi..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence! Enough of your GAMES! (tearing at her dress)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have torn apart this country for you, gone against every principle in my heart, I've endured the doubts and counsel of good men and silenced them with the axe...just to be with you.. HENRY tears her dress. He forces himself on top of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now prove to me it was worth the sacrifice. He pushes her back against a table, slamming her down, an enters her roughly. ANNE cries out in pain..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop, you are hurting me..!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 140 That night: ANNE is being groomed by MARY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was he with you? As a lover?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tender. a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprisingly so. a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? ANNE's face. Haunted. Fearing the worst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reason. OVER THIS we FADE IN: the sound of bells ringing.. 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 41 A small ceremony. Held in secret. The distant sound of cr protesting. Booing. Jeering. MARY watches from the shadow ARCHBISHOP CRANMER marries HENRY and a visibly pregnant A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in LATIN, we see sub-titles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you, Henry Tudor, take Anne Boleyn as your lawful wedded wife..? HENRY's face: eyes burning with self-loathing..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. Their voices are almost drowned by the SHOUTS of protest dissent coming from the streets..`Whore', `Witch'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 142 MUSICIANS play in the corner, struggling to drown out the of the PROTESTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A party is in progress. ANNE, the bride, is at the centre proceedings, visibly pregnant and finally Queen. But it h brought her no peace. The cacophony from outside visibly troubles her. MARY stands by her side. Maid of honour. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear? On the way to the church? They were calling me a witch. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All that will die down as soon as they get to know you. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what if it doesn't? What if they hate me forever? MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't. They will see how much the King loves you, and follow. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (haunted, hollow) How much the King loves me? ANNE shoots an anxious look over at HENRY, who is with CR in the corner, lost in serious conversation.. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ister, I wonder if you've given any thought..to the matter of my returning to the country. With the children. ANNE's face: her expression changes. Suddenly fearful. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No! I need you here more than ever. Besides, as the Queen's sister, you can't live alone out there like some gypsy. We need to make you a proper match. earing this, the passing WILLIAM STAFFORD freezes.. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the Duke of Suffolk? ANNE indicates an ugly, fat COURTIER.. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the ladies at court are mad for him. Or Lord Fardingly. indicates an OLD courtier, in his 60's) Marry him and you'd own half Scotland.. WILLIAM STAFFORD's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 143 MARY is walking back to her apartments, when WILLIAM STAF runs after her, appearing in the corridor behind her..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Mary.. STAFFORD catches her up..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't help overhearing. And before you agree to any of your sister's matches, let me just say.. STAFFORD takes a deep breath. His heart racing..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..I have saved money...not a lot...but enough. I've my eye on a place in the West...Tatton...near where I grew up.. MARY turns, an incredulous look..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hat? (surely this is a joke)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stafford? TAFFORD blurts it out..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary...I love you. There..I've said it. From the moment I joined your family..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.. MARY looks at him. A lightening flash of recognition. She heard those words before, and puts two and two together..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was you, wasn't it? At the masked ball?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Stafford..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary..I have watched how your family has treated you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you came withFFORD(cwould )never STA me..I ont'd

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: betray you...or take you for granted..I would love you and cherish you to my dying day..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's impossible. You know that. Now Anne's Queen, my family would never allow it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you would CARE? What THEY think? After everything they have done to you? TAFFORD stares incredulously. Then goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 144 MARY's face. Lost in thought. STAFFORD's words still ring her ears. She sits at the foot of ANNE's bed. ANNE sits i Heavily pregnant. On the other side is GEORGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I look hideous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little nips and stabs. MARY isn't listening. She is lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just imagine. It it's a boy. The unholy trinity will be mother, uncle and aunt to the next King of England.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if it isn't? The King will take that as evidence of God's displeasure. And will turn further against me. He's already become so cold. ANNE touches her stomach anxiously..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say you can tell by the shape of the stomach. Mary, what do you say? Boy or girl? ANNE tails off when she sees MARY. Miles away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter with her? MARY looks up, `What?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been like this for days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mooning. You're not in love, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? (blushing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly not.. MARY gestures dismissively..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flustered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In love! MARY returns to her book, flicking pages. But privately s shocked. Is it that obvious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 45 A darkened room. ANNE screams out. She is in the middle o giving birth. With a bone-chilling scream, a head appears

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And again, one more.. ANNE pushes again. MARY holds her. ANNE howls in agony. H nails dig into the sheets. A last, primal, blood-curdling of pain..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's done, your Majesty..!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well done... PHYSICIANS and MIDWIVES swarm around the baby. ANNE, desp having lost a great deal of blood, tries to sit up..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a girl! MARY takes the child from the MIDWIFE, holds it for ANNE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful, healthy girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNE is overcome by maternal love, but realises what this mean. She stares at the baby. Fear filling her eyes..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 146 MARY watches from a distance, as SIR THOMAS and NORFOLK t King. HENRY staggers from the disappointment, as if he ha delivered a blow..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has named her Elizabeth. After your mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the child healthy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfectly, Sir. HENRY stares, hollow-eyed. Finally..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if we can have a healthy daughter, we can have a healthy son. HENRY turns, and without a word, pushes past everyone, an leaves. ANNE is left alone, her heart breaking.. MARY stares at ANNE. A stab of compassion. Not long ago t thing happened to her. Hoping to console ANNE, MARY hands beautiful new BABY over to her... ..ANNE takes the BABY in her arms. Filled with love for something that will almost certainly mean her destruction Her shoulders shake with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 147 ANNE stands by a window, staring out. Her hands wringing anxiety. MARY is in another corner, tending to baby ELIZA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it? MARY leaves the BABY, goes over to the window. Looks out. below, HENRY is walking with an attractive young LADY..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady Somerset, I believe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yesterday it was the wife of the French Ambassador. The day before with the Countess of Salisbury. (a frustrated gesture)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could he DO that to me? So SOON? ANNE stares at MARY..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I know how it must have been for you. ANNE reaches for MARY's hand. Their hands touch. Briefly. MARY pulls away her hand, still not quite ready to forgiv And goes to tend to the crying BABY ELIZABETH..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 148 MARY is with her children, reading them a bedside story. next door, the sound of raised voices. The KING and ANNE having a furious row. But MARY is not listening..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't ignore me like this. I am your wife! Why don't you just admit it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ecause it's not true!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liar! I can smell the whore on you! Get away from me! You disgust me! SLAP', the sound of someone being struck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 149 ANNE and MARY are together. ANNE is combing her hair. Str it come loose in her hands. Her eyes are hollow with stre skin pale and covered in a film of perspiration..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I struck him today. What am I doing? I am destroying this all on my own.. ANNE looks left and right. Makes sure no one is within ea Goes to check outside her door, then returns..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't sleep at night! And without sleep I cannot think!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Anne..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: nd it's getting more and more difficult to arouse him. Some nights he cannot do it...at all. I have to resort to ever more disgusting...then he hates himself in the morning...hates me even more for what I made him do... ANNE eyes stare. She rocks back and forth..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's slipping away, Mary. I can feel it. MARY takes ANNE's hand. Envelops it in hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 150 The sound of ugly, loveless sex. Cries of pain. ANNE trie keep the KING aroused. Demeaning, cruel, shaming, loveles 1     HENRY repeatedly strikes her. Hating her. Hating hi 51

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the neighbouring room: the ugly sounds of ANNE and HEN sex come through the walls. MARY covers her ears with a pillow, blocking out the nois escapes to the only safe world she knows. That of her dre 152

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIR THOMAS BOLEYN, NORFOLK, GEORGE BOLEYN and MARY are wa intently as ANNE is being examined by several PHYSICIANS. nbearable tension. Finally a PHYSICIAN straightens, turns face the FAMILY..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And..? The PHYSICIAN's face: he nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 153 A magnificent winter party to celebrate ANNE's pregnancy. River Thames is frozen over. It's a lavish spectacle. Jousting on ice-skates, bear-baiting with dogs, MUSICIANS dancing, sledges and fire-eaters and Muscovite tumblers.

dialogues.speaker: G
dialogues.text: G

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The KING threads his way through COURTIERS and ENTERTAINE Wherever he goes, people stop their conversations, bow in Inimidated. ANNE, visibly pregnant, sits on a throne. Alone. She look drawn, frightened, and tired. An unmistakable echo of QUE KATHERINE at the masked ball earlier. EORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so, it's come to this. Our sister is with child, and all England's fate is in the balance. EORGE indicates ANNE.. GEORGE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's a boy, the King will have been vindicated in getting rid of his first wife, and his authority will be unassailable. But if it isn't. Or if, God forbid, she miscarries. EORGE indicates HENRY, who's face is also drawn, dark, malevolent, suspicious. Barely recognisable. GEORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The King will have to move swiftly to silence his enemies. He will claim innocence. That he was corrupted. Anne will swiftly be replaced as Queen, by someone more `acceptable'. (a beat) And we Boleyns will never be able to show our faces at court again. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's no bad thing. MARY shudders to herself. Holds her children protectively MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone with any sense would have run away from this hell-hole already. As far as they could go. GEORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ike the wise William Stafford. MARY turns... MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? GEORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't know? Sold up and went. Left for the country. Just like that. Gone to live in some place called..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under her breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..Tatton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where he grew up, apparently. Did you know he came from a better stable than all of us? His grandmother was a Beaufort, cousin to the King. And he never mentioned it. (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who'd have guessed? EORGE shrugs, and skates off with FRANCIS WESTON. We pull to reveal they are being watched by JANE PARKER.. ..who looks drained. Lonely. Worn out by the humiliation failed marriage and the agony of unrequited love. 154

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `HAAARRGGH', ANNE bolts awake in the middle of the night. face is pale. She is covered in a thin film of perspirati flinches in pain. Holding her stomach.. Immediately doors open, and several SERVANTS and LADIES a But ANNE composes herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine, thank you. (visibly paranoid)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a bad dream. Reassured, the SERVANTS fill ANNE's glass with water..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flinches as she speaks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But fetch my brother and sister, will you? The SERVANT bows, and goes. As soon as ANNE is left alone slowly looks down, and pulls back the bedsheets..

dialogues.speaker: W
dialogues.text: hen ANNE sees what lies beneath, she howls in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 155 MARY and GEORGE arrive breathlessly in ANNE's room, to fi ANNE is on the floor before the fire, her arms wrapped ar if she were hugging herself. On the floor beside her is a bloodstained bundle of sheets. ANNE looks up through the trailing locks of her hair..

dialogues.speaker: M
dialogues.text: A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lost it. Almost without pain. And so fast it was over in a moment. MARY looks down at the bundle of sheets.. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heart cracks) Oh, Anne.. MARY hugs ANNE tightly. All animosity now gone.. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ou have to get rid of it. Bury it. Get rid of it somehow. No one must know. EORGE rushes to a cupboard, and pulls out a cape. He wrap around ANNE. Then he pours wine into a glass. MARY wraps a blanket to warm her. And begins making the bed with fre linen..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN HOUR LATER: ANNE is composed. Staring into the fire. M GEORGE sit on either side of her. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not the first. Miscarriage. MARY's heart cracks. Takes ANNE's hand. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will take it as proof that I cannot bear children. That I am cursed by God. And should be dispensed with. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? There's still time. You could sleep with the King, and fall pregnant again. No one would know.. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he King would never lie with me now, and risk damaging the `child' he believes I'm carrying.. a beat) Besides, he is barely capable anymore. And I couldn't go through that again. ANNE stares at MARY and GEORGE.. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, if I am to survive..I have to take matters into my own hands. MARY and GEORGE exchange blank looks..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I..I don't understand. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a baby, Mary. rolling eyes) Must I spell it out? MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean lying with another man? ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. GEORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that would be treason. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: esides, where would you find someone you could trust? ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously, it would have to be someone close. Very close.. ANNE stares meaningfully at her BROTHER.. GEORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What..? horrified) No..! MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it, Anne! It's madness.. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you see? This affects all of us. If I go down, so do all of you. The only way to save ourselves..is to do this.. (a beat) And pray it's a boy. MARY covers her mouth in horror, gets to her feet.. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't listen to this.. (feeling nauseous) ...this is monstrous.. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary, sit down.. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Anne! I understand you have had a shock tonight. A terrible shock. But there is no need for this..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY reaches the door, turns to GEORGE..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come, George.. GEORGE gets to his feet..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is staying. He understands this involves the whole family..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Come, George..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George, is STAYING! EORGE freezes..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (her heart cracking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I pray for you both. MARY turns...then goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary! Come back! 56

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY leaves the room. Tears stream down her cheeks. She r down the corridor, rushing towards her children.. But as MARY goes, we REVERSE ANGLE TO REVEAL: A figure sits in the shadows by ANNE's door. Someone who heard everything that has been said..

dialogues.speaker: I
dialogues.text: t's JANE PARKER. Who turns, holding her head, covering he ears, unable to listen to any more..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 157 MARY runs through the corridors in an agitated state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 158 MARY rushes into her room. She goes to the beds where her CHILDREN are sleeping. MARY gently shakes them awake..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, darling wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Away from here. Far, far away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 159 ANNE and GEORGE stare at one another. ANNE pours a mug fu mulled wine.. ANNE takes the first step, and starts unbuttoning her bro shirt. GEORGE quickly knocks back the glass of mulled win ...then gasps as ANNE puts her hands into his trousers. T eyes meet for an intense moment..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 160 MARY and her CHILDREN ride through the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 61 ANNE and GEORGE are making love. Silent tears are streami GEORGE's cheeks Visibly traumatised. ANNE tenderly wipes them away. 162

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY and her CHILDREN continue to ride through the night. They gallop, silhouettes against the moon. The faster and further they get away from court, the better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 163 Afterwards: ANNE and GEORGE lie in silence. ANNE strokes baby brother's hair. GEORGE rocks to and fro. Staring at fire..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 164 JANE PARKER gets to her feet. Numb with shock. She stares Momentarily loses her footing. Then disappears into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 165 MARY arrives in a market village. She asks directions. Th kicks her horse. Rides on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 166 A simple farmhouse, nestling in a valley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 67 MARY stands in front of the door, protectively holding he children. A flicker of panic passes behind her eyes. What DOING? She knocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who lives here, Mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone. (clears throat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A friend. o answer. MARY knocks again. Still no answer. MARY hesita then tries the door. It opens..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 168 MARY enters, calls out, `Hello?'. No answer. Inside: it's warm, inviting, idyllic. The CHILDREN go to kitchen table. Instantly feeling at home. MARY calls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William? o answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama, I'm hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too. MARY stares. What should she do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 69 The CHILDREN eat hungrily. A clock ticks on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 170 MARY puts CATHERINE to sleep in a bed. YOUNG HENRY is alr fast asleep in another bed. MARY draws the curtains. hen closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 171 MARY walks along a corridor. She looks in the bedroom. MEN's clothes in the wardrobe. No sign anywhere of a woma presence. MARY turns, then catches sight of herself in a Her hair is bedraggled. Her clothes are filthy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 72 MARY pours hot water into a bath. The room is thick with She begins unbuttoning her dress. 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 73 WILLIAM STAFFORD and several FARM-HANDS return from worki the fields. Talking and laughing. They reach a crossroads their separate ways. STAFFORD rides on for a while.. ..then stops when he sees a horse outside his house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 74 STAFFORD dismounts his horse. A quizzical look. Then he w towards the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 175 STAFFORD enters his house to see empty bowls of food on t table. HILDREN's boots by the door. And a WOMAN's riding cape. rom upstairs, the sound of splashing. STAFFORD expression changes. He slowly goes up the stairs. he sound of splashing gets louder. A WOMAN's voice. Hummi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 176 STAFFORD pushes open the door. MARY is in the bath. Washi herself. MARY looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STAFFORD's eyes. MARY's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just didn't know where else to go. STAFFORD walks in. MARY gets up... No modesty. No shame. No effort to cover herself. STAFFORD sweeps her into his arms.. No words. No explanations. Time for that later. hey fall into a passionate embrace, and sink to the floor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 177 Time has passed. Winter has become spring. We're in an id country church. MARY and WILLIAM STAFFORD are being marri PRIEST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you, Mary, take William as your lawful wedded husband?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 178 A dance is in progress. MUSICIANS play. Fifty or so GUEST MARY is talking to a friend. In another corner: she notic MESSENGER arrive. A former COLLEAGUE from court. e talks to STAFFORD. They talk gravely. STAFFORD's face i ashen.. MARY excuses herself from her friend, crosses the room, g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: News from court. TAFFORD avoids MARY's eyes..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hat? It's Anne. Tell me.. (fearing the worst)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She miscarried the child?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 179 ANNE is walking alone. Her MAIDS follow at a distance. Pr she lets out a cry. Her body doubles up in pain. Her MAIDS rush towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 180 Back at the dance. STAFFORD continues..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say it was deformed...monstrous. She is charged with incest and of summoning the devil. Your brother, too. He has already been sentenced. Anne is in the Tower, awaiting trial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 181 ANNE in a prison cell at the Tower. Frightened. Vulnerabl 82

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY face: horrified.
