dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must go. MARY turns to walk out. STAFFORD blocks her path..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And do what? George is doomed. For Anne it's only a matter of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can petition the King..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ou think he will listen? It's his own neck he's saving by getting rid of them, can't you see? MARY stares..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, go. But if you do, you might as well kiss your children goodbye. You are Anne's sister. That alone makes you her accomplice and co-conspirator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no choice. Anne and George are my family. I cannot desert them. MARY walks towards the door..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what of your new family? Your

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry and Catherine have you. Anne and George have no one. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.. 183

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of galloping hooves. MARY rides hard, towards L

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 184 ANNE is led into a great courtroom lit by flickering torc and filled with fifty or sixty of the country's most powe NOBLEMEN. ANNE walks to the centre of the room, surveying `jurors', noting that they have remained seated..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a sad day for England when the nobles do not rise for their Queen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And even sadder when that same Queen is charged with adultery and incest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charged is different to convicted, Uncle. Or is it not? In this court? Deathly silence. The clearing of throats. Then with much scraping, the NOBLES reluctantly get to their feet..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master Cromwell, read out the indictment.. CROMWELL gets to his feet..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The charge is that in the twenty-eighth year of the reign of our Sovereign Henry, King of England, his wife, the Queen, being seduced by the Devil, did knowingly commit adultery, high treason and offences against God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you plead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not guilty, my Lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 185 MARY thunders across bridges, through villages. Urging on horse. No thought of rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNE faces the LORDS, as she makes her case..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My noble Lords..the love I have for my brother is the love any sister would have for someone with whom she has grown up in the same house, nursed when sick, played games as children, shared life's celebrations. As ANNE delivers this speech, our CAMERA slowly pulls bac back, towards the door..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is the love I have for him. Not what you suggest. Our CAMERA pulls out through the door... ..and into a corridor beyond, where we find HENRY hunched shadows, eavesdropping, his face cast in shadows..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge me, my Lords, as you see fit. But never forget that your verdicts will be judged again by God, in the greatest court of all.. HENRY's face is a study of guilt. His knuckles whiten, hi dig into his hands..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Lords, the time has come to cast your vote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 187 MARY gallops through shallow streams, spraying water..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 188 ANNE watches on as each LORD takes it in turn to get to h feet, and deliver his verdict. First CROMWELL, then the SEYMOURS, then HENRY PERCY.. The verdicts rain down on ANNE, `Guilty, guilty, guilty', round the courtroom, until they reach the DUKE of NORFOLK meets the eyes of her UNCLE..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unflinching)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guilty. NORFOLK stares at ANNE. Not a hint of compassion..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In which case, the burden falls on me to pass sentence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 89 A terrified GEORGE BOLEYN is led to the scaffold. He is w by FRANCIS WESTON..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 190 MARY reaches the outskirts of London. Gallops through vil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 191 GEORGE BOLEYN's eyes are covered with a cloth. He puts hi on the block. A PRIEST says last rites as GEORGE's arms a back. Terrified, his lips mouth prayers..begging forgiven The axe falls. A huge ROAR goes up. REVERSE ANGLE TO REVEAL: this has been watched by SIR THO BOLEYN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 192 MARY arrives in time to hear the ROAR from the crowds. Sh dismounts her horse, exhausted from the journey, he walks against a tide of CROWDS leaving. Drunk. Laughin Talking among themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY's expression changes. Suddenly, a shiver goes down her spine. MARY feels sick. the worst, she goes up to a WOMAN in the CROWDS..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ho was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 93 HENRY walks through corridors arm in arm with JANE SEYMOU followed closely by the SEYMOUR BROTHERS, SIR JOHN SEYMOU the ever-surviving DUKE of NORFOLK.. HENRY turns a corner, then stops in his tracks when he sees...MARY waiting outside his Privy Chamber, restrained GUARDS. Seeing the King, she curtseys deeply..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary..? The SEYMOUR BROTHERS draw their swords, but the KING's DO excitedly towards her. HENRY gestures for the SEYMOURS to their swords..       H

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave us. The SEYMOURS leave. The DUKE of NORFOLK hesitates..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL of you! NORFOLK shoots MARY a look, then goes. HENRY turns and le into..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 194 His private room. His sanctuary. Where he took her before room to which only MARY seems to have had access..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Majesty.. (falling into a deep curtsey as HENRY closes the door ensuring their privacy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand my family has offended you. But having taken my brother today, I beg you to spare my sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Mary...

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: H H

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I realise you must replace Anne as Queen. (a beat) But must she die, too? HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has been tried and found guilty. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could send her away. ENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am bound by the law. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could send her to a nunnery. No one would know. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne? To a nunnery? HENRY almost manages a smile. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is precedent, my Lord. Louis of France did it, too. When his wife could not conceive. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The French Queen was a blameless woman. Your sister a witch. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand Anne has offended you. I ask only that if there is any regret you might..feel yourself. ENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For your part in the matter.. MARY treads delicately. Realising the very suggestion is treason. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..does not unduly colour your thinking. Killing Anne will not make it go away. (a beat) It would only make it worse. ENRY stares at MARY.. HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could I have made that mistake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly his eyes are full of regret. And sadness. HENRY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Choosing her over you? ENRY thinks. A long silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: o. I will reflect on the matter. MARY falls on one knee. Kisses his swollen, bejewelled ha gratitude. HENRY stares, watching her as she goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 195 A team of CARPENTERS erect gallows and scaffolding. Hamme knock nails. A sickening metronome of death. OTack', `tack', `tack'. n the hill: a blood-stained chopping block is put into pl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 196 The doors to ANNE's cell open. ANNE looks up. In the door MARY. MARY stares at ANNE.. ANNE's appearance is shocking. She looks ten years older. Haggard and lined by stress. ANNE puts on a brave face, stares back at MARY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Anne.. The two sisters walk towards one another, and embrace. Ti Tears run onto each other's shoulders..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How has it come to this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ssshhhhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 197 A LIEUTENANT gives a nod. SOLDIERS raise a barrier, and a the CROWDS that have been waiting to rush forward. he CROWDS swarm over the grassy hill...putting down coats...reserving seats..anxious to secure the best views

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 198 ANNE looks out through a narrow window. Her intense, fear eyes flit and dart..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're letting the crowds in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right. You will be spared. The King as good as gave me his word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The King saw you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. ANNE manages a rueful smile..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all made a mess of that, didn't we? We all underestimated little Mary. ANNE looks at MARY..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think he ever stopped loving you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is. He never loved me in the same way. And deep down you know it. MARY averts her eyes..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have been Queen. You even gave him a son. But instead all this has happened because.. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I couldn't bear to be the Other Boleyn Girl. ANNE shrugs..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now look? The sound of approaching footsteps. ANNE looks at MARY, s frightened..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold me.. The two SISTERS fall into an emotional embrace as the JAI keys turn in the lock..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll look after Elizabeth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will be all right. Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he couldn't ask for a better moth... (breaks down, composes herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY hugs ANNE tight..`Sssshhh'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: e will spare you. I am sure of it. ANNE takes a deep breath. Tries to look serene..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 199 A roar of the crowd. ANNE, wearing a shawl of white ermin violently jostled and spat at as she's marched across Tow to the scaffold. She shoots MARY an anxious look across t crowds..

dialogues.speaker: M
dialogues.text: MARY shoots a signal, "Don't worry." ANNE climbs the step faces the CROWDS. Finally the jeers subside..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...I come here to die...a loyal subject.. More spit, jeers and abuse. MARY stands on tiptoe, cranes neck. Anxiously scans the CROWDS for the GUARDS that will ANNE..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..I..I do not blame the King. Never was there a more just or goodly Lord.. Presently, MARY sees two SOLDIERS pushing through the CRO towards her. Her heart leaps..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..I beg God's forgiveness and his mercy..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNE looks up to see the SOLDIERS reaching MARY, and hand a letter. ANNE smiles in relief. MARY opens the letter an reads..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Madam..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 200 THOMAS CROMWELL, the former assistant to WOLSEY, who has replaced him, sits at his desk, writing the letter..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..the King has spared you because of his respect and affection for you and because you are the mother of his son."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 201 MARY continues to read the letter, as ANNE is forced to k the EXECUTIONER..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "But you risked your life coming to court and you are advised you not to do so again. You will not be shown the same clemency a second time. Your sister Anne was tried and found guilty, her crimes were high treason and she deserves to die. Cromwell." MARY, who is reading, looks up in horror..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! ANNE looks up. She sees the look on MARY's face. MARY's eyes. ANNE's eyes. `WHOOSH', the masked EXECUTIONER swings his sword. ANNE i beheaded. MARY almost chokes.. The CROWD falls eerily silent. A stunned calm descends on Green. Nothing but the sound of the wind. MARY sways, then falls backwards, having lost consciousne falls, falls..but is caught by a strong pair of arms.. ..WILLIAM STAFFORD, who has followed her to London. Suddenly the CROWDS burst into life. A great, bloodthirst echoes around Tower Green as ANNE's head is lifted aloft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILLIAM STAFFORD carries MARY in his arms. They walk agai flow, of teaming CROWDS, and newly-arriving FAMILIES comi watch the spectacle..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 202 SIR THOMAS BOLEYN sits by a window. Staring out at the fi beyond. Ashen-faced. Broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 203 We're moving through a cornfield. At speed. The sound of children's laughter. Excited shrieking.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTION
dialogues.text: s in the opening scene: three CHILDREN, a BOY and two GIR run through the fields, playing. Touchingly, they are bar taller than the corn, heads skimming along the sheaves..

dialogues.speaker: COURT FOR THE REST OF THEIR LIVES."
dialogues.text: REVERSE ANGLE TO REVEAL: the children are being watched f distance by MARY and WILLIAM STAFFORD, standing outside H Castle. MARY smiles, shielding her eyes from the sun.. CAPTION #4: "MARY's SON, HENRY, WENT ON TO BECOME CLOSEST

dialogues.speaker: AND ADVISER TO HIS COUSIN ELIZABETH.."
dialogues.text: We CLOSE on YOUNG HENRY and ANNE's unmistakable red-heade daughter ELIZABETH..
